1.content:
BEEP BEEP BEEP BEEP BEEP!

The sound of Naruto's alarm clock went off with a start, rousing Konoha's least favorite prankster from sleep with a start. With a trained hand that had dealt with such an infernal contraption for the longest time, he slammed down on it, bringing silence to the room once more. Slowly, the boy sat up in his bed, stretching his limbs out and yawning in the morning sunlight.

Naruto scowled a bit after a moment and heaved a mild "Blech!" sound, sticking his tongue out in disgust. He suffered the occasional bout of disgusting morning taste just like everyone else, but for some reason, it was really bad today. 'Better go brush my teeth immediately then', he thought, pulling off his walrus-shaped sleeping cap and stumbling across the apartment to his bathroom.

Naruto went through his morning ritual as he always did. He pulled out some toothpaste, picked up his toothbrush, applied one to the other, looked up into the mirror, and...

The toothbrush fell into the sink with a clatter. Whatever sleep remained in his eyes was now long gone; the boy, if he could even be called that anymore, was now wide awake as he stared in utter shock at the face that looked back at him.

What does Naruto see?

"Shit! Shit! Shit! I can't go outside looking like this!" Rushing from the bathroom, the now blonde girl opened the door to her bedroom, momentarily letting go of her pajama bottoms. This proved to be a mistake as mid step into the room they fell to Naruto’s ankles, causing her to trip and tumble to the floor face first.

Rubbing the forming lump on her nose, she got and made her way over to the closet, all the while using one hand to hold her pajama bottoms up having learned from her previous mistake. Naruto rummaged through the closet throwing clothes over her shoulder left and right. Finally a cry of “A-ha!” left her lips as she pulled back from the closet holding an old pair of black pants.

Naruto had outgrown them a few years back, but had decided not throw them out. ‘Looks like it has paid off. These should fit perfectly.’ She thought. And indeed they did. While on normal, boy, Naruto they wouldn’t have fit. With girl Naruto’s slimmer frame they fit snugly. Although they were a little short, stopping a few inches above her ankles. The pants would have to do for now.

Deciding to clean up the pile of clothes Naruto had thrown out of the closet later. She walked out into the living room and sat down on the sofa. ‘Now that I’ve calmed down.’ She thought. ‘I need to figure out what I’m going to do now.’ Anymore thought on the subject though was interrupted by a knocking coming from the door. “Huh? 121121.content:
Naruto stared fearfully at the reflection in the mirror that showed the young Hyuga heiress staring back at him. "W-what is this?" He whispered in his new soft and clearly feminine voice. The sound of Hinata's voice coming from him only made him shake as his fear started to turn into panic. Raising a shaking creamy-white skinned hand, Naruto touched his new face hoping that this was just some genjustu or a weird dream and he'd wake up. He however found that the skin of his cheek was just as soft and supple as it looked. Not willing to believe what his sense of touch was telling him just yet, he brought Hinata's hand up and ran his fingers through the short blond hair. It was so soft. 'Hinata doesn't have blond hair,' He thought. 'Does this mean that this is really me?!? Or is it some freaky nightmare?!?'

Naruto's breathing started to grow heavy as his panic grew. He tried to think of something that he could do to prove that he hadn't suddenly woken up in a body that looked remarkable like a blond haired version of Hinata, while still dressed in his PJ's. First he tried to release any jutsu on himself, thinking that maybe he had activated his 'Sexy jutsu' and changed it so he turned into Hinata. It was a bit of a stretch to believe he had done such a thing while sleeping but, then again he had woken up to some weird things in his short life. Sadly when he tried to release it nothing happened. He quickly remembered something about pain and breaking free of illusions; the fact that any dream he had gotten hurt in he quickly woke up from only made the idea of pain all the more reasonable to him. It wasn't long till he found himself, or is it herself now, with a bleeding lip from where the teeth broke the skin and no change to his feminine appearance.

Feeling desperation settling in, Naruto stared wide eyed at his mirror which continued to show a reflection of a blond haired Hinata with a small trickle of blood coming from where her lip had been bitten. 'Oh Kami... What do I do now?'

A thought soon came to his panicked mind. With it he could at least prove that he wasn't somehow in Hinata's body; the seal that held Kyuubi. 'Hinata doesn't have the seal, so I just need to see it to prove that I'm not inside Hinata's body.' Another thought soon struck him however. 'Wait! What if it's not there? Will that mean that Kyuubi somehow got loose? Or did Hinata and I switch bodies and places? Would this mean that she is waking up at home in my body?!? And the seal is on my body so it shouldn't be able to just jump to a new body even if I somehow switched with her, right? And what about the hair color, how did that change?' His thoughts kept spiraling out of control creating worst possibilities with each second until in a moment of shear panic he ripped off his pajama shirt, leaving his upper female body bare and naked to the cool morning air of his apartment and channeled chakra.

Naruto stared into his mirror for what seemed like an eternity but, no seal faded into existence on his/her stomach. Terror gripped his heart, not even noticing the obvious difference between his male body and his Hinata body even as they sat there on display. Naruto stood there shaking slightly in shock and terror and though he mind didn't quite register it, his body shivered from the chill of the air enveloping it. 'Is the fox free now? Or is it still sealed in my boy body and now Hinata has to deal with it?!?' These thoughts disturbed Naruto greatly as Hinata might be a bit weird in his opinion but, she was still very kind to him. He did not want her having to deal with the fox. 'I need to see the old man.'

His destination in mind he made to turn only to suddenly realize that he was looking at the reflection of a half nude girl his age. Despite knowing it was wrong to do he couldn't help but, stare at the girl's rather developed body. 'How the hell does she hide these things under that baggy jacket?!? Their Huge!' He thought to himself as he stupidly reached up and cupped one of the breasts in his feminine hand. Once he started he just couldn't stop himself as the other hand did the same to his other breast and he started absentmindedly fondling his new assets. They where quite soft, yet there was a firmness to them that he hadn't expected. It surprised him to realize that the Hyuuga girl was nearly as big as the Kunoichi and civilians who where nearly twice said girls age. 'What is she suppose to do with all of this?' He wondered as he continued to mold the supple flesh in his hands; hands that just couldn't quite hold all of the marshmallowy soft mounds.

Even so, Ninata had elected to wear a hood over her head to at least hide her blue hair and ivory face a little bit, though there wasn’t much to be done about her new silver-lavender eyes.

“Um, no, I haven’t seen him at all today,” said Hinata a little nervously. She was a never a good liar around other Hyuugas, but she hoped Sakura wouldn’t pick up on her body language.

“Alright,” Sakura said relenting. “So, who’s your friend here?”

Both Hinata and Ninata froze. Neither of them were exactly ready to say what exactly happened. Heck, neither of them knew what exactly they were supposed to say. Tsunade hadn’t gone into too much depth with the cover story. And while they could just spin another lie, sooner or later, everyone would have to know about Hinata’s doppelganger.

“This is…Ninata,” said Hinata.

“Ninata, huh?” said Sakura, peering into the boy-turned-girl’s hood. “A relative of yours? Huh, you two look a lot like each other. Actually, I’d say you look like twins.”

“Well, actually,” Ninata said, not quite knowing what she should say.

“You even sound the same!” Sakura exclaimed. “Now, no offense intended or anything, but that’s kind of creepy. Wait, you’re not running around with some bunshin, are you?”

“She…well, is my twin in a way,” said Hinata with resignation. “Something happened. A jutsu went wrong and, well…they think my Yin and Yang charka got separated, and it manifested into…her.”

“Your WHAT?!” said Sakura. “How could that happen? Can that even happen? I’ve never heard of anything like that before. Are you kidding me?”

“I,” Ninata tried to get a word in, but Sakura pulled her hood down to get a look at her full head. She looked visibly shocked when she saw that it was a mirror match for Hinata’s. Seemingly without even realizing it, she reached her hands forward and pinched Ninata’s cheeks.

“Holy cow, you really are her exact double! And you’re real, flesh and blood! This is really weird!”

“Course I’m real!” said Ninata indignantly. “Why wouldn’t I be?”

Sakura looked at her suspiciously, and Ninata was starting to think that maybe she shouldn’t have said anything. Sakura was smart after all; if anyone could realize who Ninata really was, it was her.

But thankfully, it didn’t seem to go anywhere. “Sorry, sorry,” Sakura said, sheepishly letting go of her face, as if realizing what she had done. “Does the Hokage know?”

“Well, good luck with that, I guess,” said Sakura. “I better get going now. Bye, Hinata, and uh, Ninata.” And she was off.

Ninata sighed sadly when she was out of earshot. Hinata looked at her. “What’s wrong?”

“Somehow I…I just have a feeling I won’t be seeing her much anymore,” said Ninata. “Now that Naruto’s gone and I have to be Ninata now…nothing in my old life is going to be the same.”

Ninata’s downcast expression nearly broke Hinata’s heart. It was even more pitiful than when Naruto looked sad. It was a face that Hinata was herself quite familiar with, as she had seen it in the mirror many, many times.

“It…it doesn’t have to be that way, Ninata-chan,” she said, stroking her cheek. “You, you can reconnect with her, and all your old friends. And this cover story isn’t going to last forever. I’m sure Hokage-sama has something planned.”

“Well, I’m not so sure if the old hag is capable of planning anything,” said Ninata with a pout. Hinata’s touch brought a warm smile and a slight blush to her face. “But you’re right.”

Hinata’s smile mirrored her double’s. Even if the face before her was her own, the boy she always loved was still in there, and still able to bounce back as always. “Enough,” said Tsunade, rubbing her temple and trying to kill the smile that threatened to split her own face in two. “It’s too early in the morning for all of this. Can we all be professionals for once.”

"With all the cleavage you like to show off, sometimes I wonder if you gambled away all your shirts!” If she looked anything like the little blond-haired brat, or at least spoke in his voice, Tsunade would not have hesitated to backhand him with her pinky finger. But since Ninata now looked and sounded just like the fragile little Hyuuga girl, she couldn’t quite find it in herself to smack her around. Not yet anyway.

“Least you still got that smart mouth on you,” said Jiraiya. “Okay, let’s just get this show on the road before somebody professionally kills somebody else.”

The sages led the Hinata twins to a private examination room where no one would be able to hear them. Tsunade ran another check on the girls, just to compare their genes and see how Ninata’s transformation was going. “Well, for what it’s worth, it’s progressed,” she said in a resigned tone.

So, to boil it down to simple terms, while you could say that you were 99.99% Hinata yesterday, today you’re 99.999% her. “That’s something I’m still trying to figure out,” said Tsunade.

“When I first heard the news,” said Jiraiya in an oddly serious tone, “I figured that maybe Naruto was under the effect of a very powerful jutsu. But now that I’ve come to see the results, I can see that’s not the case.”

“Just how is this any different from a regular jutsu?” asked Ninata.

After lifting Ninata onto the examination table, Tsunade checked around her body, pressing her fingers onto the young girl’s forehead, shoulders, and abdomen.

“I’d say the big issue is that you’re still handling your chakra as if you were still Naruto,” she said. “Back when you were a boy, you had an excessive amount of chakra at your disposal, which gave you plenty to work with and throw around without much thought. But now, you have a more average stock on hand, likely similar to what Hinata has. You have less to work with, and the amounts you’re typically used to handling are impeding your abilities and tiring you out fast.”

“Okay, okay," said Ninata, rubbing her head. “So what do I have to do?”

“Well, in short, you have to improve your chakra control. Learn to conserve and be as efficient with it as possible. Or in other words, treat it like just about all ninjas have to.”

Ninata’s face dropped in gloom. “Aw, I’ve never been good at that stuff.”

“Actually, kid, it might not be so bad,” said Jiraiya. “Normally, it would probably be prudent to send you back to the academy so you could learn the basics for real this time. But you now have something that could accelerate your progress by leaps and bounds: the Byakugan.”

“The funky Hyuuga eyes?” Ninata said, perking up.

“Yeah. You’ll have to ask your friend outside for the details, but from what I understand, they can see all things related to chakra, as well as give you a direct look at your own coils. That is, in fact, the basis of the Hyuuga clan’s fighting style. If you’re having a hard time controlling your chakra just on feeling alone, then maybe looking at it while you're pumping it through your system will help. See when you're using too much or too little. In a way, a Hyuuga is probably the best kind of person you could have changed into."

“Okay!” said Ninata excitedly. “So I just use the Byakugan, improve my chakra control, and I can get back on the road to becoming Hokage!”

“Not quite,” said Tsunade. “It’s not just about your chakra control that needs work. You’ll also have to refine your fighting style. Even if you can perfect your control, your old tricks won’t be viable anymore. You can't really throw shadow clones around like you used to, until you can at least build up your chakra reserves again.”

Ninata sulked, letting out a disappointed groan.

“Sorry, kid,” said Jiraiya. “ It's chakra-intensive for you now. You’re just going to have to save your favorite move for more desperate situations. Which brings us to possibly the other issue, that, if addressed, might be able to mitigate it somewhat. Namely the way the Kyubi's seal appears to be acting."

Ninata nearly panicked. “Is the fox is getting out?” she said in hushed whisper.

“No, kid, the fox isn’t going anywhere,” said Jiraiya. “The issue is that the seal is now misaligned with your new feminine coils.” He took a moment to chuckle at how lewd that sounded, earning him a dirty look from both Ninata and Tsunade. “Huh?” But before Ninata could react or even brace herself, the toad sage slammed his palm right into her abdomen. “You…bastard,” she panted. “When I…get up…I’m gonna…”

Ninata pushed herself up, glaring daggers at the old man. “What did that do? I don’t feel any improvement.”

“Of course you wouldn’t, dummy” said the old pervert. “You’ve only lived your whole life with the seal giving you access to the Kyubi's chakra. I've just brought things back to normal for you. Now that this seal has been adjusted to match your new body,” he said, tapping Ninata’s bare stomach, much to the girl’s chagrin, “you should be able to tap into it again. “Okay,” said Tsunade with a sense of satisfaction. “I think we’ve done all we can right now. My men should be almost done moving your stuff to your new place, so you're free to go for the time being.”

121222221112112122212112222211221211.content:
They walked the streets of Konoha in a somewhat uneasy silence, carrying Ninata’s new wardrobe. The girl who used to be Naruto was looking quite flustered in particular. “You realize that we probably won’t be able to show our faces in there again.”

Hinata was blushing too. “Um…I’m sorry Ninata-chan. I guess I got a little carried away. I didn’t know you would have…that strong a reaction.”

“I couldn’t hold it in!” Ninata nearly wailed before clamping a hand on her mouth just in case anyone heard. “You drove me absolutely crazy in the ninja store. And then when you started…doing that in the other place, it was too much!”

“Well, um,” Hinata replied, doing her best to press fingers together as always did, while holding the bags. “I’m sure they didn’t notice anything. That perfume I bought was really strong. It had to have masked the smell.”

“They probably know. Everyone does. I bet the cashier heard everything,” Ninata whimpered, looking sadly down at a bag of her new clothes. “I just got these and already most of them need to be washed!”

The two continued on until they reached their new home. Ninata didn’t know quite what to feel about that. Sure, her old apartment wasn’t the most prime piece of real estate in the village, but it had provided the roof over her head (his head?) for as long as she could remember. It was familiar and comfortable. How would her new place be? Would it be better? Worse? Would it have a safer neighborhood? Would the roof leak on them? Would the fridge light actually turn on? Did they even have a fridge? Did it come with a washing machine where she could wash the…girl juice off her new clothes, or would she have to continue going to the laundromat? She didn’t know what kind of strings Tsunade had to pull to secure this new place on short notice, but she sure hoped the Hokage hadn’t gone too cheap on her.

She began to feel a little hopeful as they neared the complex. The neighborhood didn’t seem too bad. It wasn’t upscale or anything, but it certainly did feel a bit more clean than her old place. She just hoped there were some ramen shops nearby. Not that Ninata would ever give up on Icharaku’s of course, but since it was now farther away, it would be nice to have a place where she could run out and grab a quick bite to eat quickly and on short notice.

There wasn’t much to say about the apartment complex from the outside. It seemed to be a little smaller than Ninata’s old place, only two stories tall, and it appeared that she would now be living on the ground floor. She was a little disappointed by that. High places were fun after all.

Luckily, when the two girls entered the apartment, she could already see that was small potatoes. The place was definitely bigger and more spacious, good enough for two growing girls. It was a bit more old-fashioned, looking much like the Hyuuga compound’s interior, with tatami flooring and sliding doors, but that had its charms. Ninata thought she could get used to this.

And sure enough, Tsunade had delivered on her promise to move all of Ninata’s stuff here. There were boxes of her old stuff all piled up, as well as some pieces of furniture, like the table and chairs from her old kitchenette. Though Ninata couldn’t help but scowl at the realization that they hadn’t brought her bed along. Okay, sure, it came with the old apartment so it technically belonged to the landlord there, but still!

“Um, Ninata-chan, there are futons in the closet.” Hinata had noted her twin’s concern and slid open a door to reveal the soft mattresses and quilts that would serve as their new beds.

“Oh. Well okay.” Ninata didn’t know what to think about that. As a ninja, she wasn’t so fussy about where and how she slept, but she had been enjoying her nightly activities with Hinata-chan. She just hoped they could still enjoy them this way. Otherwise, she might have to get a new bed…and she wasn’t so sure she was ready to see Gama-chan get so emaciated after buying one. This latest shopping trip had already thinned out her poor little froggy wallet considerably, even though Hinata had agreed to pay for half of it.

“Well, looks like this is going to be our new home then,” said Ninata. “What do you think?”

“It’s nice,” said Hinata with a small smile. “I think we could get used to this.” She gave Ninata a small hug and a peck on the lips. Ninata blushed, wondering if Hinata was about to get amorous again, or if she was expecting a return for the “favor” she had recently given the former boy right now. “I’m going to go get my own clothes, as well as get changed. See you in an hour?”

“Oh, okay,” said Ninata, not knowing if she should be relieved or disappointed. “See you soon, Hinata-chan.” And she went and returned her own kiss.

As Hinata departed, Ninata took a look at the bags of her new clothes. Well, if there was one thing that the…wild rendezvous in the dressing room had yielded, it’s that it would make it easier for her to decide what things to wear for her date tonight. She would just have to pick something that was clean.
121222221112112122212112222211221211.title: New Home

1212222211121121222121122222112212111.content:
(This chapter was originally written by JG)

Ninata went to another room where she separated the clothes that were clean from the ones that were dirty, seeing that were only two decent outfits clean while the rest were dirty, judging by the smell. "Jeez, that just had to happen to us. . ." She mumbled as she looked at two outfits she placed on the bed.

The first was a normal outfit that civilians would wear, a black and white stripe t-shirt with the clan symbol for the Hyuga and a pair of blue pants. (reference: http://i.dailymail.co.uk/i/pix/2010/06/0... ) "Well, these would be fine, but I don't know if Hinata-chan would like me wearing this. . .something seems to be changing about her. . .and part of me likes it." She thought as she placed then clothes on the bed.

The other outfit was different, Ninata thinking that Hinata never would've bought her this. It was an incredibly sexy short black dress with a matching pair of heels. (Reference: http://www.fatalwoman.com/images/detaile... ) "On the other hand. . .I never thought Hinata-chan would pick out this kind of outfit for me. . .she might like it. . .but I don't know what would happen afterwards. . ." She thought as she placed the dress on the bed.

"Gah. . .which one to I choose!?" Ninata exclaimed as she rubbed her head in confusion.
1212222211121121222121122222112212111.title: Finding the Cleanliness in the Cum

choices: Hinata enters the apartment in short order
12122222111211212221211222221122121112.content:
Ninata decided to try on the black dress. It was as tight a fit as it looked, and its dark fabric clashed strongly with her pale skin, which shined brilliantly through the slits cut into the sides. It felt very odd to be on her. Not in an unpleasant way, but she honestly didn’t feel like she was wearing anything at all. And if something happened to either of these straps on her shoulders…she didn’t want to think about it. It would be very embarrassing, especially since it didn’t seem like a bra would go well with it at all.

Next she tried the heels. They were much less comfortable and felt like a bit of a squeeze for her dainty feet. It’s not that they were too small, it’s that her feet weren’t used to being encased in anything like them. Worse, they screwed up the way she could walk. Ninata had to spend a long time, had to be at least 30 minutes, just walking around experimentally. Turned out her usual gait just wouldn’t work with high heels on. Her steps had to be lighter, her stride had to be shorter, and her feet had to lightly hit the ground heel first. She couldn’t even run properly in these things!

“Man, why would anyone ever want to wear these?” she said. Their only saving grace was that they helped Ninata feel a little taller than usual. It sucked to be the shortest kid in class, and while she knew her new Hinata-esque body was taller, it was only by a couple of centimeters. She supposed being a little bit bigger had to count for something.

Still, taking a close look at her high heels, Ninata couldn’t help but get a few interesting ideas out of them. “I bet if I sharpened them, then I could throw them at people and take out someone’s eye. No one would ever see it coming!”

That was a brilliant idea. She’d have to write that down later and maybe get a few more heels that she could properly weaponize. Watch out, bad guys! Uzumaki Ninata the high heel killer is on the loose!

“Or would it be Hyuuga Ninata?” she asked herself. She supposed it would; she couldn’t really call herself Uzumaki anymore. Damn it, this whole change-into-Hinata business could get really confusing at times.

Oh well. Now that she was properly dressed in something fancy and had familiarized herself with the heels, all that was left to do was wait for Hinata to return.
12122222111211212221211222221122121112.title: Ninata Looks Good in Black

121222221112112122212112222211221211122.content:
She didn’t have to wait long. Hinata had arrived in a few short minutes, carrying a few suitcases that likely contained some of her belongings. When she set them down on the floor, Ninata got a look at how she had made herself up. She was wearing a blue dress that matched the color of her hair. The skirt was long in the back, easily extending down to her ankles, but notably shorter at the front to show off her creamy legs. It was strapless, leaving her shoulders bare, but was still low enough to present an ample amount of cleavage. To top it all off, Hinata’s lips were fuller and glossier than usual, a sign that she had applied makeup. The effect made her look older, more daring, and even more alluring

The only thing that betrayed the effect was the furious blush on her face. She was clearly not used to going out in public like this much. Not that Ninata minded; she looked too adorable for words. Adorable and sexy.

“You look good, Hinata-chan,” she said, stepping close and hoping her words would at least put the ailing Hyuuga at ease.

It seemed to work, as Hinata’s flustered frown smoothly turned into a smile. “Th-thank you, Ninata-chan. I like your choice of dress t-too.” At this wrapped her arms around Ninata and ran her hands along her double’s back, tracing the edges where the fabric was cut to expose her skin.

Now it was Ninata’s turn to blush. She was feeling equally odd in her own dress. She had never done anything like this before, for obvious reasons, and had no idea how she looked in this thing, or if it was even appropriate. But Hinata had chosen it for her and the born-Hyuuga was definitely enjoying it, so she supposed it would work.

The two locked their hands together and took a deep breath. They each exchanged a shy smile to one another and stepped out into the evening air. It was a shock to both of them to feel the breeze blow onto their exposed skin, and to be out and about in Konoha looking all dolled up as they were, but neither were willing to let a little awkwardness get in the way of a romantic outing.

I can’t believe it, thought Hinata excitedly. My very first date with Ninata-chan! I never thought I’d ever get to experience this.

Meanwhile, Ninata’s thoughts were running a mile a minute. My first date with a girl…damn it, I don’t know what to do! Man, now I wish I read more of those kissy-kissy romance stories I never liked. I sure hope I don’t screw this up. But when she glanced at Hinata, and saw how happy she looked, she felt a surge of her old confidence spark up. I won’t screw this up! I’m Uzumaki, er, Hyuuga Ninata! And I’ll be the best dater ever!
121222221112112122212112222211221211122.title: Hinata enters the apartment in short order

choices: Hit the town for more fun
1212222211121121222121122222112212111221.content:
Unfortunately, only a few steps out the door, Ninata realized that she would have a long road ahead of her on that front. Her foot somehow got lodged in the grass, but her body hadn’t quite realized that yet. Before she knew it, she was falling face-first to the ground.

Luckily, a flash of dark blue indicated that Hinata was quick to the catch. Ninata didn’t have to fall far, and her landing was much notably softer than it could have been. For two very good reasons.

Mmm, Hinata-chan feels so much better than I recall, Ninata thought with a relieved smile. She’s so strong and gentle and dependable and warm and…and…uh-oh.

She looked up into Hinata’s concerned eyes from her position right between the Hyuuga’s soft, supple breasts.

“Ninata-chan? Are you okay?” she asked, not really noticing the predicament they were in.

“Um, I’m fine!” Ninata said, jumping back to a standing position. Her cheeks were red, as if they had been burned by the contact with Hinata’s lovely lady mounds, but she couldn’t help but feel a pang of disappointment to leave them so soon. “Just, um, still getting used to walking around in these things.”

Hinata trailed down Ninata’s form to her feet on the ground. She couldn’t help but giggle at the sight. “Hm, hm, Ninata-chan, your heel sunk in the grass.”

The rest of the trip went by uneventfully. Hinata had coached Ninata on the fine art of walking in high heels over different terrains every step of the way. While the boy-turned-girl was thankful for it, she was already forming plans on how to deal with the accursed things in the future.

When I become Hokage, I’m going to outlaw all high heels in the Land of Fire. No woman will be forced to wear them again, and I’ll be treated as a hero! Yes, that’s what I’ll do!

Ninata let Hinata lead the way. They eventually settled at a restaurant called Akinara’s, a relatively upscale-looking place that had all the workings of playing the romantic angle: dim candlelight, soft traditional music in the background, and a faint smell of tea leaves throughout and sake in the back. It was the type of establishment that would think itself too rich for Naruto’s business. Back when she was younger and male, Ninata had been tossed out of places like this regularly, even when he clearly had money to pay for food. While it probably would have been odd to let an unattended kid eat in alone, they didn’t have to be such jerks about it. Of course, that had all happened before Naruto had ever learned of the damn demon fox.

Ninata shook her head. That was all in the past. She couldn’t let bitterness cloud her mind, right when she was trying to have a nice time with her new girlfriend. Besides, the people here didn’t seem to mind her presence. Like most everyone else in Konoha so far, they just looked more surprised and confused at her than anything. Though she didn’t know if it was the presence of the identical Hyuuga twins, the way they held their hands, or how pretty they both looked. Ninata had to blush at that last thought, as well as constantly check to see if her dress was still covering her. Ever since she put this slinky thing on, she had been worried that it might slip off and she wouldn’t notice until it was too late.

A tug on her arm interrupted brought her back to reality. “Our table’s ready,” said Hinata.

They took their seats and placed their orders. While waiting for the food to arrive, Ninata couldn’t help but feel a little fidgety. It was nice to take some time to relax after such an eventful (and arousing) day but she still didn’t know quite what to make of this situation. Sitting in a fancy restaurant and being treated with respect was one thing, and being on a date was another. Right now, neither she nor Hinata had anything to do but sip their water and look at once another. She felt like she should do something to kill the time, but what could that possibly be? Could she try talking? What could Hinata possibly want to talk about? She had never felt closer to the lavender-eyed beauty that she had turned into, but there was still plenty more to learn about her.

Funny…back when Ninata was Naruto, he had been trying so hard to get Sakura to go out on a date with him. But now that she thought about it, she had no idea what exactly he could have done if the pinkette had ever said “yes.”

“Is something wrong, Ninata-chan?”

Ninata snapped her gaze back to Hinata, who was looking at her with concern in her eyes. “Um, n-no, it’s nothing,” she said, putting her index fingers together in a very Hinata-esque manner. Hinata didn’t look convinced. Ninata sighed, slumping her shoulders in defeat. “Okay, okay. I just never did anything like this before, alright? And I know, I just know I’ll probably scr-ah, make a mistake somehow.”

But Hinata only giggled. Ninata-chan’s so cute when she’s nervous, she thought inwardly. Outwardly, she said: “It’s okay, Ninata-chan. I…don’t really know what I’m doing here either.”

As Hinata continued to laugh quietly, her twin was finding it hard to keep her own amusement bottled up. Before she knew it, she was about ready to let out a loud guffaw that would have echoed across Akinara’s. Luckily, she placed a hand over her mouth, muffling it to a far more ladylike chuckle. I really am just taking this too seriously.

As they finished up and the tension died down, a small question began to nag at the back of Ninata’s mind. “So, Hinata-chan…you…had feelings for me for a long time, right?”

That caught Hinata off guard. The alarmed expression on her face looked much like the one Naruto had seen her put on seconds before she would bolt from his presence. “Um, well, I…yes.”

“How come…you never told me?”

It was a simple question, the answer of which Ninata was merely curious about. But when Hinata broke eye contact with her and looked to the side guiltily, the former boy felt alarmed. Ever since she had undergone this transformation, Hinata had been oddly chipper and full of confidence in herself. And when she wasn’t that, she was very…sultry. But now, she was looking like her old self: deflated, unsure, and sad. Ninata didn’t want that. She didn’t want to see her twin and her lover looking like this. And she didn’t want to be the one to hurt her.

But before she could usher out an apology, Hinata said: “I…didn’t think you would…accept me.”

“Accept you?” said Ninata, taken aback. “Why wouldn’t I-”

Although, now that she took a moment to think about it, she began to wonder why herself. Back when she was Naruto, he always thought of Hinata as “that dark, weird freaky girl who always turned away.” She weirded him out, but otherwise never stood out in a crowd to him, even when her exotic eyes were taken into account. It wasn’t until the Chuunin exams that he started to actually pay attention to her. Thinking about how little he used to think of this wondrous girl before her right now made Ninata feel a little guilty herself.

“My father considered me a failure,” Hinata continued. “I was an unworthy heir for the Main House. The Branch House considered me only as someone to serve at best. And Neiji-niisan…” She bit her lip as particularly painful memories began to surface. “I…just couldn’t…please anyone…no matter what I did.

“But when I saw you…I still felt unworthy. You had it worse than me. My problems were all at home. But you had to deal with the hatred from everyone, Ninata-chan. From every adult, everywhere you went. But you were better than me. You never gave up, no matter how much the odds were stacked against you. I still don’t know how you did it. If I were you,” she broke into a small smile, noting the irony in that statement, “I think I would have broken a long time ago.”

“Hinata,” said her twin, not quite knowing what to say.

“So I had to get stronger,” the Hyuuga continued. “I had to become more like you. So that I could become someone…you could like. Someone…you respect.”

She stopped, shutting her eyes to quell the flow of tears that threatened to spill from them. She didn’t want to get emotional right here. Now was supposed to be a time of happiness with the one she loved, not the sadness of the past. But had she just ruined it? Would things be awkward between she and Ninata just because she dared to spill her heart out?

Her question was answered when Ninata said in a reassuring voice: “You don’t need to do that.”

Opening her eyes, Hinata was greeted with the sight of her own face smiling lovingly at her while extending a welcoming hand across the table. “I already told you,” Ninata said, “I like people like you.” Sighing wistfully in relief, the born-Hyuuga reached her hand forward to entwine her delicate fingers around her twin’s. They felt so warm and gentle, as they always had whenever they caressed her bare skin.

The food eventually came, and the two girls took the time to enjoy their meal and learn more about one another, talking about happier and more pleasant things.
1212222211121121222121122222112212111221.title: A Lovely Dinner Date

1212222211121121222121122222112212111221.content:
The girls finished dinner, but they weren’t quite ready to go home just yet. The night was young and there was still so much to do. The Hyuuga twins walked hand in hand in the streets of Konoha. Neither girl had a particular destination in mind; they were happy enough just being in each other’s company.

Hinata had regained her newfound mischievous side, and she would take every opportunity to grope Ninata’s butt, run a hand down her side to touch the exposed skin, or play with the straps of her dress. While Ninata found the treatment embarrassing, she was happy to see Hinata bounce back to her old, or rather, new self after nearly breaking down in the restaurant.

As they turned down a corner, something caught Ninata’s eye.
1212222211121121222121122222112212111221.title: Hit the town for more fun

1212222211121121222121122222112212111221.content: Ichiraku's then?
1212222211121121222121122222112212111221.title: Where else?

choices: Ninata has all of Hinata's memories
Ninata only recalls things at the time she was "born"
1212222211121121222121122222112212111221.content:
No matter how much things had changed for her, it was good to know for young Ninata that Ichiraku still served the best ramen around. Even though she had a full dinner in her stomach, her mouth watered when she picked up the alluring scent of the old man’s cooking. She supposed it wouldn’t hurt to treat herself to some pork ramen.

“Just don’t overeat, Ninata-chan,” Hinata told her. “Don’t want you falling asleep early.”

Ninata knew what that meant. So one bowl of pork ramen it would be. It was probably just as well; Hinata’s smaller body likely didn’t have nearly as big of an appetite as Naruto’s. And she wouldn’t want to get herself fat anyway.

Huh, I guess I am starting to think more like a girl, thought Ninata as she slurped up her noodles. She cast a glance over at her girlfriend, who was happily munching on a cinnamon bun. Might have to ask her if she does anything to keep her weight down.

“Naruto?” a voice asked from behind her.

Ninata nearly choked on her noodles and fell off the stool. Who said that? Did somebody find me out? Am I changing back? What?!

“Ninata-chan?” Hinata gasped, leaping down to check on her.

“Sorry,” the mysterious voice said with a sigh. “Didn’t mean to startle you.”

As Hinata helped Ninata back onto her feet, which wasn’t easy because of those vile heels, they looked up to see who the intruder was. It was Sakura, looking a little embarrassed to cause a scene.

“Sakura? What’s wrong?” Hinata asked in a somewhat guarded manner.

“Nothing, nothing,” the pinkette sighed again, taking a seat. “I was just hoping a certain someone would be here.”

“Uh, who?” Ninata asked innocently, playing dumb. Recalling the last time she saw her old teammate, she had a good idea on who Sakura was looking for.

“That…stupid idiot!” said Sakura, clenching her fists on the counter. “I’ve been looking for him all day. I’ve gone everywhere he could possibly be. To our old training fields, to the shops where he could be buying weapons, and even this place! And for once, I haven’t seen so much of a thread of his stupid orange jacket!”

Ninata had to bite her lip hard just to keep herself from saying: “My jacket’s not stupid!” Sitting back down on her stool, she clamped down hard on her remaining noodles. Hopefully, they would keep her distracted.

“I even checked his apartment,” Sakura continued in a notably softer, sadder tone. “And would you believe that it’s completely empty now? Lights out, furniture gone, and available for rent. It’s like he fell off the face of the earth.”

“Um, did you try asking his sensei about it?” said Hinata cautiously. She mentally smacked herself once the words left her mouth. I really should sound a little more surprised by that.

“No, can’t ever find Kakashi-sensei when I need him either,” Sakura said glumly, not picking up on Hinata’s oddly calm demeanor. “I did ask the Hokage though. She said he was leaving to go training with her old associate, Jiraiya. Indefinitely. So they put all his stuff in storage and cancelled the lease on his place.”

“So, why did you come here?” asked Hinata. She couldn’t help but feel a little suspicious of Sakura’s motives.

“I’ve come here five times already. This is Naruto’s favorite place to eat, after all. I was hoping that maybe, just maybe, he was still around here somewhere, getting one more bowl for the road. But I guess not. If he’s not here now, then he’s long gone now.” Sakura now looked genuinely hurt. “Stupid jerk didn’t even have the decency to say goodbye.”

“So, why are you trying to find him?” said Ninata curiously. If she had been Naruto, he would have jumped for joy at the prospect of Sakura looking for him for once. But experience had taught her that that would never be the case. And even if it was, she had Hinata now, who was a much better girlfriend anyway.

“It’s a long story,” said Sakura, casting a glance over at the former boy. “I don’t know how much either of you know…in fact, I don’t know how much you in particular know.” Her earlier depression seemed to have disappeared for the moment. In its place was a tone of interest and fascination. “Do you, like, have all of Hinata’s memories, or do you only recall the time when you were, uh, ‘born?’ I’m sorry if that sounds weird to you, but I’m still trying to get around the whole chakra split thing you two have going.”

Both Hinata and Ninata paused and exchanged troubled glances. How were they supposed to answer that question? They hadn't quite hashed out all the details of their cover story, and there would be holes in whatever lie they spun. What could they say?
1212222211121121222121122222112212111221.title: Yeah

1212222211121121222121122222112212111221.content:
“Um, yes, she does have my memories,” Hinata blurted out before Ninata could think of an answer. “Everything I know, she knows. Except when it comes to my training. She’s still completely inexperienced with that.”

Ninata didn’t know what to say about that. Oh great, does this mean that I need to know all the nitty-gritty details of Hinata’s life and the customs of her house? Oh man, how many more lies do we need to spin to keep this story going?

“Huh, that’s odd,” said Sakura. “Well, anyway, it happened a couple of days ago. I went to go see Sasuke at the hospital. He was being even moodier than usual. More hostile. And he picked a fight with Naruto. They fought on the roof. But it wasn’t some friendly spar, or one of their usual spats. They really looked like…like they wanted to kill each other.”

“What?” Hinata asked as Sakura took a moment to wipe the oncoming tears from her eyes. Surely, there had to be a mistake; Naruto would never want to hurt any of his fellow Leaf nin, even if Sasuke was his rival.

“If-if Kakashi-sensei hadn’t arrived,” Sakura continued, “I…I don’t know what would have happened.”

“Sakura,” Ninata whispered in an apologetic tone before snapping her mouth shut. She knew that incident had upset her teammate. And while at the time, she (or he) had simply told the pinkette that it was between he and Sasuke, she was now thinking Sakura honestly deserved an explanation. But she could say nothing about that right now.

“Something happened between them, but I don’t know what,” Sakura blurted out. “They’re keeping me in the dark. Kakashi-sensei wouldn’t tell me anything. But I know Naruto would…I know he would be honest with me. Eventually He would tell me everything, even if he’d embellish it to make him look bigger.”

I would not!

“But I can’t even get that!” Sakura looked like she wanted to either cry or punch something. “I can’t even get an explanation, because he’s gone and disappeared in the wind. Just like that.”

“I…don’t know what to say,” said Hinata sympathetically.

“I’m sorry,” said Sakura in a softer tone. “It’s been stressful for me. I shouldn’t have dumped it on you two. I know you have your own problems.”

Ninata wasn’t going to let this go by, though. Sakura was seeking her for help, and while she couldn’t quite give it as it she was, she could at least try to do something. “Well, if Sasuke’s still around, you could maybe speak to him. Maybe you can get through to him.”

Sakura sighed. “I’m not so sure that’s a good idea. He doesn’t want me around in the best of times. And he doesn’t talk much as it is.”

“You have to at least try. Maybe he’ll open up to you if you’re persistent enough. Maybe he’ll tell you what’s eating him. Or maybe it’ll get him out of his funk. You never know. And you never will if you don’t just get out and try.” She looked directly at the pinkette and flashed her big trademark toothy grin. Though it likely looked very silly on Hinata’s face.

Sakura didn’t say anything for a while. Then she nodded, with a small smile. That sounds a lot like something Naruto would say.

“You’re right,” she said. “I will go talk to him. Don’t have any other choice now, and I can’t dance around this issue forever.” As she got up, she turned to Hinata and added: “You should try listening to her.”

"I have been," said Hinata said with a cryptic smile of her own. "Longer than you realize."
1212222211121121222121122222112212111221.title: Sakura's Troubles

choices: Hinata opens the door in swift order

Another blow on Ninata's part spun the conjoined Sound-nins into a circle, whipping them around so that Ukon was now facing the Hyuga twins. And when he locked eyes with Hinata, his face twisted into one of animalistic fear.

"We have to move NOW!" he screamed. With a panicked cry, he extended a leg from the depths of his brother's body and launched another decisive kick at Ninata. It collided with her ribs and sent her rolling to the ground again. But just like the last time he did that, it did little to slow her down, for she was on her feet in less than a second. There was a flash, a loud bang, and before she knew it, searing white light flooded her enhanced vision. With a cry, she fell down, the veins in her temples retracting as her Byakugan deactivated. She clutched her face as her eyes burned hot, unable to see anything else.

A flashbang. And a powerful one too. I was careless.

Hinata lied prone, rubbing her eyes desperately. Blurry whiteness was all around her, and for a moment, she began to fear that she had gone blind. But as soon as that thought crossed her mind, things began to dim. Shadows returned to her sight and everything sharpened like a film reel brought into focus. It wasn't anything special; just an ordinary flashbang that induced temporary visual irritation over a wider radius than usual. Sitting up, the naked girl looked around. Sakon and Ukon were nowhere to be seen, but thankfully, Ninata was still in sight.

1212222211121121222121122222112212111221.content:
Unfortunately, it seemed that her girlfriend was just as prone and helpless as Hinata was, looking much like a discarded doll. Ninata lied pinkly on the shadowy forest floor, her skin coated only by a layer of sweat. The fiery aura around her was gone. "Ninata-chan?" Hinata cried, dashing to her double without recalling when she stood up, her heart hammering in her chest.

Ninata moaned in response. "Hurts," she said in hoarse voice.

Hinata knelt down next to her girlfriend and extended a hand to her shoulder. "Ninata-chan, what's wrong?"

"Don't...know," said Ninata, pushing herself upward, wincing painfully through clenched teeth. "Feels like...I'm burning up inside."

Hinata fired up her Byakugan. Focusing deep into the network of chakra coils throughout Ninata's body, she nearly gasped at what she saw. Every vein-like passageway in the girl, every Tenketsu point on her skin, every possible area that could hold chakra looked seriously swollen and enflamed, as though a thousand bees had worked their way into her flesh and stung them. "Ninata-chan, your chakra coils have been severely burned," she said in as clinical a tone as she could muster, though an edge of worry still dribbled out. "They've...undergone a lot of stress, possibly from that...red chakra you were using." Now she really wanted to ask about it.

"Damn it!" Ninata snarled, pounding a fist weakly into the ground. "Can't do...anything right!"

"I-it's alright, it's not permanent, you'll heal," said Hinata, pulling her girlfriend up to her knees to hug her reassuringly. She suppressed a shudder when she felt her hard nipple prod into the soft flesh of Ninata's bare boob, though it also made her bite her lip in frustration. Why couldn't she just be back at the riverbank? Why couldn't she and Ninata just lose themselves to the carnal hunger for each other's flesh that they both constantly craved? Why did they have to be here? It wasn't fair!

"You just need to...rest a little," she continued, shoving her anger off to the side. Letting her emotions and her lust out wouldn't do either of them any good.

"N-no, we can't. We, we have to find them!" Ninata weakly pushed herself back so that she could look directly into Hinata's eyes. "I...I b-broke that f-freak's nose. But...but when the other one merged with...him, it, it...I saw it go back into place."

"What do you mean, Ninata-chan?"

"I-I think...they can...uurrghh...heal when they're together. If we don't...find them soon, th-then they'll be...co-completely restored."

"Then we need to take this chance to retreat ourselves," said Hinata, standing and pulling her twin up with her, draping Ninata's arm across her shoulder.

"No!" cried Ninata. "We...we have to fight-"

"You're in no position to fight, Ninata-chan," said Hinata in a rare and strangely authoritative tone. "Right now, we need to get as far away from here as we can. Find somewhere to hide, catch our breath, maybe find the others."

Ninata looked like she was about to argue some more, but Hinata continued. "Besides, I don't see the Sound-nins anywhere. I don't think they'll be coming back anytime soon. They're demoralized, need to lick their wounds, and as far as they know, we're both still healthy. They won't be coming back."

Ninata sighed in resignation and let herself fall limply on her girlfriend. "A...alright. Good point. We'll do what you say."

The two walked in silence together on the forest floor, one identical naked girl supporting the weight of the other. Hinata would have normally loved the close skin-on-skin contact, and on some level she was enjoying it. Even under the circumstances they were in, she couldn't resist trailing a hand down to cup the soft flesh of Ninata's butt.

However, she couldn't help but be concerned. Ninata was slightly feverish and clearly in pain. The way she winced and groaned heavily with each step she took reminded Hinata of how she personally felt whenever she had been forced to work, train or fight with blisters on her palms and feet. While she'd never know what Ninata was exactly experiencing right now, she imagined the poor girl honestly felt like she was rolling around in a bed of hot coals. There weren't going to be any long-term problems for the former boy, Hinata was confident of that...but whether she liked it or not, fighting anymore today was simply out of the question.

Still, Hinata's mind couldn't help but go back to the crimson chakra that Ninata had summoned. Where did it come from? Why haven't I heard of anything like that before? Is it due to her transformation? Or was it something else?

As much as Hinata loved Naruto's transformation into Ninata, there were still a plethora of mysteries surrounding its nature. And now that she wasn't in a position to enjoy her twin's body, she now had no choice but to think about it. What had caused the change? Why had the boy turned into her of all people? Why were they so drawn to each other? And what other effects would the transformation have? There were so many questions, and with even the two most knowledgeable ninjas in the village completely stumped, answers would not be coming anytime soon.

choices: Have Sakon and Ukon made a comeback?
1212222211121121222121122222112212111221.content:
"Why...am I so...useless?" Ninata whispered, interrupting Hinata's train of thought. "Why...can't I do...anything right?"

"You're not useless, Ninata-chan," said Hinata, drawing her in close for a comforting half-hug. "You're just not used to my body is all. I know that if you work hard, you'll-"

Ninata wasn't going to hear it though. "I just...wanted...to save Sasuke. I just wanted...to be useful. But nothing's...gone right today! Nothing! Every time...every time I think I've...made some...progress...something always makes me...weak." Her body shivered as though a cold wind had passed over it.

Ninata's words caused Hinata's heart to nearly break in two. She had heard them many times before in her life in that exact voice. But at the same time, something was telling her that Ninata really did not need a shoulder to cry on right now. What she needed was a dose of reality. Experience had taught Hinata that wallowing in self-pity wouldn't get anything done, and now was definitely not the right time for that. Some situations called for a little more bluntness than usual. "Ninata-chan," she said in a gentle but firm tone, "I know exactly how you're feeling. But you're not ready for this kind of situation. You should...you should that."

"I do know that!" snapped Ninata, causing Hinata to nearly jump. It was the first time she had ever spoken to Hinata with any sort of anger, and the born Hyuga couldn't help but flinch as if she had been physically slapped. "But I...can't be expected...to do nothing. Not when...my friend is..."

"And a team of ninjas were on it!" Hinata snapped back through clenched teeth. "Shikamaru-san and the others had the situation under control! We honestly shouldn't have come here!"

It was not like Hinata to use such a sharp tone, especially toward the one she loved, but she was not having the best of days right now. When she had brought Ninata into the woods to train, she had all sorts of lofty expectations in mind. She wanted to help her twin get familiar with her new body, show her some of the new techniques she herself had been working on, swim, dance, have a fun and romantic time together, make passionate love with the splendor of nature all around them...only for it all to be horribly dashed thanks to some unwanted passerbys. And over the course of...oh, she didn't know how much time had passed since then, she had been seen completely naked by her peers, got herself nearly killed multiple times, saw Ninata almost die without being able to do anything about it, and was now being shouted down by the one person she pined her whole life for. Hinata was stressed, frightened, humiliated beyond measure, and her usually bottomless patience was starting to wear as much as she was.

And to top it all off, her loins were still tingling with want and arousal. Moisture occasionally dripped out of her nether regions and trickled down her legs while her swollen clit brushed against her labia again and again. It begged her for attention; it wanted to be stroked, pinched, diddled, licked and sucked. And it was driving her crazy!

"So that's...it?" Ninata hissed, her voice laced with ice. She probably would have shouted if such an action didn't hurt so much. "We should lie back when our friends...and fellow...ninja...need our help? I expected...urgh...better of you."

That hateful tone and the deathly glare she felt Ninata bore into her struck Hinata like a gentle fist straight to the heart. Where did Ninata get off accusing her of that? What made her think that Hinata didn't care about her fellow Leaf-nin, even if hardly a single one of them was aware she even existed? What the hell did Ninata know? The young Hyuga liked to think she shared the former blonde's endless idealism, but one didn't need the Byakugan to see reality. "What help can we provide?" she said in an equally cold tone. "We're naked, you're injured, and you can barely even do basic jutsu! What could we possibly do for anyone right now?"

"I don't know! But ninjas...can't just...give up and turn away. Only a...selfish coward...turns her back on her...village...and friends."

Hinata balled her hands up into fists. So I'm a selfish coward now, is that how you see me? she thought, her teeth grinding loudly in the stillness of the forest.

She couldn't do this anymore. For what had to be the first time in her life, something in the Hyuga girl snapped. "So that's how it is?" Hinata nearly shouted, her eyes welling up instantly. "I'm a selfish coward because I don't want you die? Because I won't let you throw your life away, just like that?! You want to go out and die pointlessly?"

"I don't intend on dying-"

"But you will, Ninata-chan! In your current state, you won't stand a chance against any of these Sound ninjas! And I'm doing everything I can to keep that from happening! But none of that means anything to you!" Screaming and sobbing openly, the blunette dropped both her Byakugan and Ninata into a heap on the ground. "Fine then! Go out and get killed if that's what you really want! Leave me! Just like everyone else has!"

Ninata only looked up at her in shock. If she felt any pain from her fall, she made no sign of it. "H-Hinata-chan?"

"It's always the same!" wept Hinata, her mind a whirlwind of chaos. "No matter how much I try, I'm never good enough for anyone! It's just like Neiji-niisan says. Nothing ever changes!"

Now Ninata looked like she was the one who had been kicked, though in Hinata's mind, that was likely from the lingering pain in her coils. It's not like a damn thing she ever said would get through the dense girl's skull anyway. "Go! Die! Fuck Sasuke like every other girl wants to since he's more precious to you than I ever was, even when he treats you like dirt. I don't care anymore!"

"H-Hinata," said Ninata in the smallest voice imaginable, her face crumpling up as though someone had balled it up in their hands like a sheet of paper. "I...I'm sor-"

A dark shadow descended on them, and before either girl could react, a large humanoid form crashed upon the earth.
1212222211121121222121122222112212111221.title: Lovers' Quarrel

1212222211121121222121122222112212111221.content:
"Well, well, well," said a familiar guttural voice from hell. "Look what we have here."

Ninata immediately went cold. She knew that voice. She knew that tone. And just hearing it caused a ghostly chill to fall over her. "Oh no."

"Sorry to interrupt your little lovers' spat, sweethearts," said Sakon as he thrust an arm out and seized the startled Hinata by her neck. "But my brother and I have a few matters to discuss with you two!"

He held the small girl up in the air, his lengthy reach keeping the Hyuga out of striking distance from his torso. Hinata gagged helplessly in his grip, her normally soft voice reduced to choking growl as the flow of life-giving oxygen was cut off from her lungs.

"No," Ninata cried, reaching her hand out to them from her position on the ground. They were only a few feet away, but with what little strength she could muster in her current state, they might as well have been on the other side of the globe.

"Don't give her a chance to fight back, niisan," said Ukon, positioning his head right next to Sakon so he could look his enemy in the eye before she died. Both of them looked much healthier than before; their wounds had healed nicely, their skin had returned to its healthy shade of ivory, and there appeared to be no amount of discomfort between them. "Break her neck!"

"As you wish, Ukon," said Sakon as he tightened his grip on the naked Hyuga's throat, savoring the faint wheeze that escaped her dainty lips.

Panic overtook Ninata. Her girlfriend was in trouble. She was dying. They were killing her, choking the life out of Hinata. Her large lavender eyes were bulging out of her sockets, her struggles to escape from their grasp were rapidly slowing down. She tried to strike Sakon's arm with her family's trademark jyuuken, but it seemed she couldn't so much as insert a drop of chakra into her fingertips. The taller ninja didn't even flinch at her touch. And there was nothing Ninata could do about it.

"Hi...nata," she wailed in her weak voice, trying to push herself up. No, she couldn't give up, not NOW of all times. She could do this. It wasn't as bad as the last time she was flat on the ground in front of these freaks. She had energy now. She had strength. It just...hurt a lot to use it. But she could handle it. She would do anything for her Hinata-chan. Any pain was worth enduring as long as it meant Hinata was safe.

But the more force she put into her muscles, the more the heat in her coils flared up. Getting herself up to a sitting position was like rolling around on a bed of needles. No problem, I'll just call on my lazy-ass tenant again, she thought with a joyless smile. We'll save Hinata together.

1212222211121121222121122222112212111221.content:
But as Ninata looked up at her girlfriend, she sadly realized that there was no way in hell she would ever be able to stop Sakon or even reach him fast enough on even the Kyubi's power. Hinata was going to die. She was going to die resenting Ninata and thinking that the former boy didn't care about her at all. All because Ninata had been stupid enough to think she could actually save Sasuke.

I'm sorry Hinata-chan. I'm sorry for being so insensitive. I'm sorry for calling you a selfish coward. I didn't want this to happen, I didn't want to leave you. Please...don't leave me!

And then it happened. A spiraling white tornado seemingly tore through the forest until it careened into the shared stomach of the single-bodied twins with all the force of a charging bull. They squealed in unison as they were sent flying into the nearest tree, leaving a neat Sakon-and-Ukon-shaped crater in its trunk, dropping Hinata neatly next to Ninata. When everything came to a stop, the small vortex stopped spinning, came to rest on the ground, and vanished completely, leaving in its place a little white puppy.

And on the other side of the girls, less than twenty feet away, stood Inuzuka Kiba, wearing an expression of pure unmitigated hate focused with pinpoint accuracy at the Sound-nins. "Get away from her, you BITCH!" he roared.

=========================================================

Hinata wasn't able to see what happened next. She heard the sound of rushing air and crunching leaves, followed by the growls and barks of violence, not all of which were human. She was too distracted by her coughing, the crushing sensation she felt in her throat, and her own burning lungs that gasped desperately for air.

"Hinata-chan," Ninata murmured as she reached a hand over to the blunette who only a few seconds ago was a hair's breadth away from death.

"I...I'm fine," Hinata wheezed in a gravelly tone. "Just....need to breathe."

Ninata nodded and let her girlfriend catch her breath, all the while keeping a hand planted on the hunched girl's bare shoulder and trying her best to ignore the fighting happening not too far away. After a few moments, Hinata stopped coughing and her breathing regulated. She rubbed at her windpipe, which still felt soar, but it looked like she wouldn't suffer any lasting damage. With that out of the way, she locked eyes with Ninata's. They had never looked bigger, redder, or more watery before in her life, and her whole face was twisted into an expression of relief mixed with deep remorse. Whatever anger Hinata felt towards her double before was gone in that very moment. She was just thankful to be able to see her love again in any capacity, as heartbreaking as it looked right now.

Before she could say anything though, Kiba suddenly appeared beside them. "If you two can get moving, do so now. Shikamaru and the others really need at least one pair of Hyuga eyes," he said, looking forward in the distance. Whether he was trying to keep an eye on the Sound twins, or avoid looking at the unclothed Hyuga twins was anybody's guess.

"Kiba-kun," said Hinata.

"Go west!" barked Kiba in a tone that told her not to argue. "Find Shikamaru. Akamaru and I will handle these guys."

Hinata and Ninata exchanged troubled glances. "But, Kiba-kun," said Hinata, "Ninata-chan's injured. She can't move too well in this state."

Without missing a beat, Kiba reached into a pocket in his coat and threw a pouch, which Hinata only barely caught. She recognized its contents immediately: his family's special brand of soldier pills. "Give her those. Adrenaline, chakra supplements, pain killers, the works. Just get moving! And for Kami's sake, stay low and avoid the archer!" He didn't give either girl a chance to respond. Drawing a pair of kunai, he leaped back into the fray alongside Akamaru, who had been keeping the Sound duo held back all that time.

"Kiba," said Ninata as she looked on, a note of gratitude and concern in her voice, but he was now too far away to be able to hear her. He tackled the conjoined Sound ninjas along with Akamaru, who had transformed into a carbon copy of his master. Within a few chaotic seconds of fighting, it became impossible to tell who was supposed to be the human and the dog.

"Here, do what he says," said Hinata as she handed a pill to Ninata. Hinata didn't particularly like to use these pills. They left one exhausted and utterly drained after a few days, prolonged use could have harmful effects on various parts of the body, and there was always a danger of getting addicted to them. Many a foolish ninja had felt the need to consume similar pills before every fight, and while the drugs ensured they would never fall in battle, they would shorten their lives in other ways. But there was no arguing with the pills' results. They induced rapid chakra and adrenaline production in the body, sharpened the senses, and could do wonders at numbing pain, which in part made them a pretty useful medical tool in a pinch. And that last part was something Ninata really needed right now.

Ninata nodded and swallowed the pill, gagging and retching as it slid down her slender neck. "Ugh, tastes nasty," she muttered, her voice already starting to sound a bit healthier.

"Can you walk, Ninata-chan?" Hinata asked.

Ninata shrugged. "Still hurt for now. Help me up and let me lean on you for a bit, and we'll see how well this stuff works soon enough."

Hinata nodded and did exactly that, pulling her double up, holding her close at the waist with one hand while Ninata slung an arm across her shoulder. She prepared to take a step when a familiar-sounding cry cut the air around her. Hinata stole a glance back. Kiba was being held aloft in Sakon's hand, the Sound-nin scowling at him with a hateful expression as those hideous black marks spread across his skin. He then slammed the boy hard into the ground, shaking the earth furiously.

Her heart stopped. Kiba was hurt, and while she liked to think that her teammate and friend, who was much like the older brother she wished she had, could handle himself in a fight, she didn't know how he would fare against this kind of enemy. The Hyuga suddenly felt a strong urge to set Ninata down somewhere and return to the fight, so she could...help him in some capacity. She knew more about the Sound twins' fighting style than anyone else here.

But he told me to find Shikamaru. He told me the others need our eyes, and it sounds like they're in danger.

Hinata was stuck. It seemed like everyone needed her help, but she couldn't be everywhere at once. If the Byakugan was absolutely needed, then of course she would use it where applicable. As much as she wanted to just turn back to Konoha, she understood that it was too late for that; both she and Ninata were in deep and couldn't just get away. But now, the urge to help Kiba was absolutely overpowering. She couldn't stomach the thought of having to leave him behind. All of a sudden, she fully understood why Ninata was so desperate to save Sasuke. Sasuke may have been nasty to Naruto, especially recently...but Ninata still considered him to be her friend.

What do I do? What do I do?

She turned to Ninata, hoping to see if her girlfriend could give her an answer, to see if she could tell her what to do. Ninata simply stared back at her, wearing a look of complete understanding. "Do what you think is right."
1212222211121121222121122222112212111221.title: A Hard Choice

1212222211121121222121122222112212111221.content:
Kiba let out a wet gasp of pain. Hinata could only look back at him as Sakon punched him hard in the chest, blowing the air out of his lungs with extreme prejudice along with a small splash of blood.

"Kiba-kun," she whispered. She desperately wanted to go back and help him. She desperately wanted to put this two-headed monster that caused her so much pain and suffering down. She desperately wanted to...there were a great many things she desperately wanted to do. But sometimes, a girl had to put what she wanted aside. Squeezing her eyes shut, she brushed another tear from her face with her free hand, turned her head away from the sight, and took off into the woods with Ninata hanging on her shoulder. She did not look back.

Ninata looked absolutely miserable. She wasn't bruised in the slightest, which Hinata noted with some curiosity, and she could feel the girl putting more strength into her footsteps, indicating that the soldier pill was doing its work. But with the expression she was wearing, one would be forgiven for thinking she had just been kicked in the ribs.

You're not a coward, Hinata-chan, you never were. If you were, you would have just left my stupid, useless ass behind, and maybe you should have..."

I wonder how it will look if it's longer? she idly thought, her mind going to a more peaceful place. We'll just have to see if we get out of here. When we get out of here.

"Hey, uh, this is very sweet and all, but would you two mind being a little less...out in the open?"

Both girls jumped and pulled away instinctively, their bodies turning red all over in embarrassment. Hinata instinctively activated her Byakugan to see if she could find the intruder. It didn't take long before saw a familiar figure leaning against a tree within some thick vegetation.

"Tenten-san!" Hinata gasped. Leading Ninata by the hand, the two nude girls crouched low and crawled through the bushes where the older kunoichi was sitting. She looked like a mess; she was breathing heavily, one blackened eye was nearly swollen shut, and the buns in her hair had been knocked loose, letting it trail down past her shoulders. She looked utterly drained and exhausted, and just by giving her coils a cursory examination, the Hyuga could tell her chakra reserves were nearly depleted.

"Are you okay?" said Ninata.

"I'm fine," Tenten said with a strained growl. Then she nodded her head off to the side. "He's not."

The Hinata twins looked over. Lying face-down in a pool of his own blood was a Sound ninja. He was an enormous brute, taller, fatter and bulkier than even Chouji, with tufts of fiery red hair poking out of his otherwise shaved head. His body looked like a pincushion of kunai, shuriken, and other assorted bladed weapons, with a wakizashi running cleanly through his chest and out his back. Judging by the fact that it had impaled his now still heart, it was evident that he was dead.

"Called himself Jirōbō, or something like that," said Tenten. "I was actually doing pretty well against him. He couldn't get near me, and all he could throw at me were some predictable earth techniques. Then...this happened." She nodded to her thigh, which was bleeding profusely from a strange and familiar-looking white arrow that transpierced it. "It...came out of nowhere. Stopped me cold. And that gave the bastard the chance to close in on me."

Unfortunately, so had a lone female Sound-nin armed with nothing but a flute. With numbers on their side, the four thought they had the advantage over the young woman. But with a few musical notes, the enemy kunoichi called three giant Doki to her side and evened things out on the spot.

Even so, the blonde didn't think the monsters would have posed much of a problem. One enemy was no different from a dozen if you could freeze them all in place and pick them off at your leisure. Shikamaru could have easily held all the Doki with his shadows, Ino could possess one or the Sound-nin herself, and Chouji and Kiba were strong enough to just pulverize whatever was left. It was a tactic that saved Team 10's bacon more times than she could count.

But before Ino or any of her teammates could so much as form one hand seal, arrows rained down from the canopy. And just like that, whatever strategy the Leaf ninjas were about to execute vanished in a puff of smoke. An archer was spying on them from high up in the trees. Where exactly he was, none of them could tell. Whatever camouflage techniques he was using were beyond flawless, and he never stayed in the same place for long. And it quickly became evident that if Ino or Shikamaru used their families' jutsus, they would have been sitting ducks.

So as it was, Chouji was forced to fight the three Doki alone, Kiba took it upon himself to track down the archer, and Ino and Shikamaru, having no real skills when it came to combat, had no choice but to cower in the shadows and wait for an opening. Ino tried to get a bead on the flutist multiple times; if she could just get a glimpse of that magenta-haired bitch, then she would have had a chance to take control of her mind. But while her song echoed throughout the forest, she was nowhere to be found to Ino's growing frustration.

As for the archer, he proved to be a frighteningly cunning enemy. Ino didn't know what the whole story was, but it looked as though he was able to stay one step ahead of the hot-tempered Inuzuka's keen sense of smell every step of the way, leading the boy into one trap after another, many of which seemed to involve spiders and webs. And if he was distracted in any way, he didn't show it, for the archer never once let up on his attack. Ino lost count of how many arrows she and Shikamaru had to dodge, while Chouji...was not so lucky in that department.

He'll recover, she told herself. You know Chouji, he's tough, he can take a beating with the best of them. That's what she told herself after the first arrow struck him, burying itself right through his shoulder. And again once another went into his stomach. And another once it buried itself in his thigh, forcing him to buckle down onto his knee...

It was evident that their current strategy was just not going to work. The flutist and archer were both untouchable, Chouji could only hold the Doki back for so long, and Shikamaru and Ino were nigh useless as long as their tree-bound enemy still lived. They needed to kill the archer, and they needed a trick that he couldn't counter. And after he, Ino and Kiba were able to get together for a moment to discuss their options, Shikamaru had a hunch that the Hyugas might just be the key they needed.

"Find Hinata or her twin and bring them back here," Shikamaru had said to Kiba, in an uncharacteristically commanding voice that told the Inuzuka it was an order and there was no room for argument. "This is top priority, so do not under any circumstances even consider doing anything else. Do I make myself clear?"

Kiba simply nodded with assent and took off. From that point on, it was just a matter of waiting. Waiting, surviving and hoping. And that's where Ino and Shikamaru were now.

Seeing that her job with field medicine was complete, Ino stood up to give Shikamaru a chance to put on his shirt and more importantly, his armored flak jacket. The wound he suffered was deep, but thankfully not fatal in part due to the jacket's thick padding. If it hadn't been there, then chances were good the arrow would have gone deeper and possibly hit a vital organ or major artery.

That thought made Ino scowl irritably. And it's just our luck that the two people we need right now have no protection on whatsoever. They had better still be alive!

As if on cue, she was nearly bowled over by two jiggling mounds of ivory that proclaimed: "Hyuga Ninata to the rescue!"

"GAH!" Ino cried, falling backwards onto her butt. "Where did you come from?!"

Ninata scratched her head sheepishly while giggling apologetically. Poor Ino looked like she just suffered a heart attack, and Shikamaru was shooting her a glare that could've melted an iceberg. Or at least, he would have before his eyes drifted down to her still jiggling mounds of girl flesh and he was forced to look away with a blush on his face and a small trickle of blood in his nose.

"Er, sorry about that," she said, sheepishly putting an arm over her boobs. In retrospect, sneaking up on them like that was probably not the best idea. "Didn't know how else to meet you though."
