Not taking a moment to wonder when she arrived, or who exactly "Pete" was, Hinata squeaked in surprise as she all but dove under the flimsy hospital blanket, which was barely large enough to cover both she and her lover.

"O-Oba-chan," Ninata sputtered, "we-we were just..."

After slamming the door shut, Tsunade closed her eyes, took a deep breath, and mentally counted to ten as she made a few one-handed seals to cast a jutsu in some shape or form, but whatever it was, Hinata could only guess. After finishing it and regaining her composure, the Hokage opened her eyes to give the Hyuga girl a stony glare.

"Young lady, you are not supposed to be in here! Explain yourself!"

Hinata felt herself go damp all over, and this time, it was not from arousal. "I-I-I-I," she stammered, putting her two index fingers together under the blanket as she always did whenever she felt nervous. The Hokage was a very intimidating woman; she had no idea how Ninata was able to talk sass to her.

"Cut it out," Tsunade snarled impatiently, pointing a finger directly at her.

"I-I-I..." Realizing this wasn't working for her, Hinata swiftly changed gears, clamping her hands together to stop her fidgeting completely and just blurted out the next words without thinking. "I needed to get relief and Ninata was the only one who could provide it for me."

Tsunade's angry expression shifted to one of confusion. "Uh, what?"

Hinata sighed. There was no way around it. Her back was to the wall and she had to tell the Hokage the details of her...sexual problems. Even if the humiliation killed her. So with a red face, she explained. She told Tsunade how she had spent a whole night and nearly a whole day masturbating. How her mind could only focus on sex, and breasts, and butts, and vaginas despite how exhausted and grief-stricken she was. How no matter what she did, she couldn't ever experience an orgasm. And more than that, how absolutely crazy it drove her.

"That happened to me too!" Ninata chimed in. "I was trying to...pleasure myself too, but couldn't. It wasn't until...Hinata-chan came to me."

"I...see," said Tsunade. "How long has this been going on? How long have you two been...intimate?"

"Ever since I turned into Hinata," said Ninata.

"When we returned to Ninata-chan's old apartment after seeing you," Hinata said, feeling they should at least be specific, "we took a bath together. We didn't think anything of it. But one thing led to another, and before I knew it...we were...we were making love. And we've made love every night since then. And that's not the only thing...I've looked at our chakra, and I've noticed that...our chakras are drawn to one another, almost magnetically."

"Interesting," said Tsunade as she rubbed her chin contemplatively, the authoritarian gone and the medical scientist taking over. "I'll need to take a look at it for myself later, but I guess that would explain why you two always greeted me in the nude when I came to the apartment to see you. It would seem Ninata's transformation has had an even greater effect than I thought. I knew that she would likely change psychologically due to her new body, but I never imagined it would affect you too, Hinata. Despite how genetically similar you both are, whatever happened to Ninata has made you both instinctively attracted to one another. And it may have also made you both, dare I say...addicted to sex with one another."

Both the girls turned red at the Hokage's clinical bluntness, but neither of them could argue against it.

"If I had known that would happen, I would never have given you two the current arrangement you have now. I would have done everything in my power to keep you two as far apart as humanely possible."

Alarms started ringing in Hinata's head. Keep her and Ninata apart? She couldn't bear the thought! "H-Hokage-sama, please don't–"

Ninata was also gearing up for a fight. "Oba-chan, you can't! I love Hinata-chan and she loves me! You can't separate us!"
1212222211121121222121122222112212111221.title: The Next Day

choices: She's willing to give him a chance
1212222211121121222121122222112212111221.content:
"If you would let me finish," said Tsunade. "That is what I would do if I had known this would happen. But it would appear that it's too late for that. Separating you two for the time being would do no one any good, which is why you will both continue to live with one another. But from this point on, you will both be subject to medical examination, since I need to stay on top of any other changes you two may undergo."

The Hinata twins both sighed in relief. "Thank you, Hokage-sama."

"Which leads to my next point, and what I came in here for in the first place. In light of the...recent events, a rearrangement of the current genin teams must be called for. Ninata, I've made my decision of what to do with you. You are to be fully registered as a Leaf ninja again, and you will be assigned to Team 8. Your instructor will be Kurenai from here on out, and your partners will be Shino and Hinata of course."

Ninata immediately lit up. "R-really! I can still be a ninja? With Hinata-chan? That's awesome! We're going to be on the same team, Hinata-chan!" Unable to contain herself, she kissed her twin right on the lips. Hinata blushed at how open she was being about their relationship in front of the older woman, but she said nothing. Truth is she was pretty happy about the announcement as well. "When do I start?"

"As soon as you're fully healed, just head over to the registry department to have your ID made," said Tsunade. "But don't get excited. After your previous stunts, you two will be doing the most menial D-ranked missions I can find for a very long time. And on that note, Hinata, since you're here, illegally might I add, you might as well make yourself useful. I'd like for you to examine Ninata's chakra coils."

"Y-yes, Hokage-sama." Hinata activated her Byakugan to peer into the inner workings of Ninata's body. Her girlfriend looked perfectly healthy; she had lots of chakra pumping through her system, and her coils looked...completely fine. A bit wider than they were last time, but the signs of chakra burn were completely gone. Which she couldn't help but find a bit strange; it normally should have taken a week or so for them to recover. "Ninata-chan's coils seemed to have fully healed."

"I feel great too!" said Ninata. "Like I could run a mile. And look, I'm not even on any pain killers!"

Tsunade looked doubtful. Putting a glowing hand on Ninata's shoulder, she observed the inner workings of Ninata's body herself. "Huh. It looks like you two are telling the truth after all. Though maybe I shouldn't be so surprised whenever it comes to you, Ninata."

Hinata didn't miss the conspiratorial tone in the Hokage's voice. But before she could open her mouth to ask what she meant, Tsunade spoke again. "Very well. If you really are fully recovered, then I supposed I can let you out of here today. No need to waste your time and the hospital's resources. But Ninata, you are expressly forbidden from leaving the village borders until I say so. Failure to comply will result in house arrest and termination of your status as a ninja. Do you understand me?"

Ninata fidgeted nervously. "I...yes, I understand, Hokage," she said, the steel tone in Tsunade's voice doing its work to put her back in line.

"Good. As for you, Hinata, I'll let this incident slide, but don't let me catch you sneaking into the hospital outside visiting hours again. I need to speak to Ninata about a few more private matters, so get dressed and get out of here."

"Yes, Hokage-sama," said Hinata. She started to push her way out of the bed, only to blush when she remembered that she was still naked under the blanket. "Um, do you think you could...give me a little privacy?"

"No," said Tsunade. "First of all, young lady, I'm a medical-nin; you don't have anything I haven't seen before. Second, consider the next few humiliating moments of your life to be your punishment for your inappropriate behavior."

Hinata whimpered, but didn't argue. All things considered, this mess could have gone a whole lot worse. Ninata, however, had a different reaction. "Ha! I bet you just want to see her naked. You're just as bad as the pervy-sage."

=====

Ninata rubbed at the sore lump on her head. "You didn't need to hit me so hard, Granny. And not in front of my girlfriend too!"

"Then you should learn to respect your elders, betters and superiors. And don't call me Granny!"

Ninata really wanted to argue, but decided it would be better to hold her tongue for the time being. Back when she was a boy, she could take a few licks, but Hinata's body wasn't quite as sturdy, and she knew well enough she wasn't fast and agile enough with it to avoid Tsunade's right hook just yet. Or even her finger poke of doom. And she knew well enough that it wouldn't be wise to push her luck with the older woman for at least the next month. She was in enough hot water already. "So what did you want to talk to me about?" she asked. She hoped it wasn't another lecture about her conduct. Hadn't they spoken enough about that?

"I was going to tell you this yesterday, but decided after everything else, that it might not be wise to unload so much bad news on you all at once."

Ninata groaned. That really was not what she wanted to hear.

Tsunade continued. "I believe that, since he was your former teammate, you deserve to hear what my, and the village's stance is, on Sasuke."

"Oh." Ninata felt her stomach clench. With the emotional roller-coaster she had been experiencing since yesterday to this very moment, she hadn't had too many chances to pay the Uchiha boy any mind. And truth be told, she didn't think she really wanted to. Not after what he almost did to her, and was willing to do to Hinata. "What...what do you intend to do with Sasuke?"
1212222211121121222121122222112212111221.title: Tsunade will do no such thing to the little lov...

1212222211121121222121122222112212111221.content:
"Before I begin, I have to explain something to give you context. Your former teammate, Sakura, was the one who reported Sasuke's departure, and at the time, she told me that he had been kidnapped by the Sound. I've since questioned her about it again, and she has admitted to omitting the truth to certain details. It turns out Sasuke was not kidnapped; he left with the Sound willingly, and he in turn assaulted her to prevent her from stopping him."

"He what?" Ninata cried. It looked like she wasn't the only person the Uchiha had attacked.

"With that key detail in place, I now know that Sasuke's decision was of his own volition. And because of that, his rank and citizenship have been stripped and he has been declared a Missing-nin to be killed or captured on sight. Preferably the former."

Ninata clenched the blanket in her hands, knowing that a deluge of emotions were about to come flooding out of her. She wondered what exactly she would feel? Would she be angry at Sasuke for his betrayal and his attempt on her life? Would she violently protest Tsunade's harsh sentence on her comrade? Or maybe she would feel sad and guilty that things had come to this. She waited for a feeling to emerge in the form of a teardrop or shout of fury. She waited and waited, until she felt... nothing at all.

"I understand," she said stoically.

The Hokage seemed taken aback. "You...do?"

Ninata nodded, though truth be told, she was just as stunned as the older woman was by how blasé she was acting. "Sasuke is a traitor. He willfully abandoned the village and joined forces with our enemy. He tried to kill me while thinking I was Hinata. It's because of him that...Kiba is dead and the rest are all injured. And as long as he's alive now, he'll continue to be a threat to us. Is that right?"

Ninata expected it to hurt to say such a thing, to speak so coldly about her "friend." But no such feeling came. Whatever feeling of warmth she once felt for the Uchiha was replaced instead by...numbness. The same kind of unfeeling coldness she felt radiating from him as he stared directly into her now feminine face with absolutely no hint of emotion. He thought she was Hinata, a person who never did a single thing to earn his ire. And he tried to kill her without even a second thought anyway. Just because a complete monster like Sakon told him to.

Ah, now Ninata felt something: a flicker of red specially reserved for that particular shinobi of the Sound. For what he did to Hinata's friend. And what he almost did to Ninata herself.

For the first time since her transformation into Ninata, the former boy was starting to get a new perspective on things. If she had been her old blond-haired male self, she might have forgiven Sasuke for the act. After all, they always got on each other's nerves and they hadn't been on good terms lately. If he had tried to kill her knowing she was Naruto, she was sure she would have paid him no ill will for it. But Sasuke was just as willing to kill someone he hardly even knew and who didn't deserve his wrath. And that made Ninata come to a realization; that she really didn't know Sasuke nearly as much as she thought she did. Did she ever truly know him, or was she simply projecting her own feelings of sorrow on another lonely individual? Was he himself ever capable of such empathy?

Ninata shook her head. She supposed she'd never know. All that mattered was that Sasuke was an enemy of the Leaf now. As long as he was the Leaf's enemy, he would be her enemy. And he would be dealt with the same way the Leaf handled all of its enemies.

"That is correct," said Tsunade, clearly stunned to have seen the normally rambunctious teen act so...compliant, though Ninata could detect a few telltale signs of worry in the older woman.

Ninata sighed. "Look, Oba-chan, I know I'm not the sharpest kunai in the pouch, but I'm not that dumb. What Sasuke did...I don't think I could ever forgive him. And I also know that as long as he's alive and with Orochimaru, he'll be a danger to the village and everyone I care about, and that he doesn't deserve special treatment just because he was, or because I thought he was, my friend. So if you feel it's necessary to...mark him for death...I understand and I accept your decision."

"I'm...glad to hear that, Ninata." And with that, Tsunade began her march to leave the room, deciding the conversation had run its course. "I'll notify the staff to have you released, and I'll make sure they bring you a fresh pair of clothes."

But Ninata had one last question on her mind. "Wait, Oba-chan!"

Tsunade turned around, shooting the blunette a pensive look. "Yes?"

"Is it...is it really necessary that I keep my identity a secret? To keep everyone from knowing that I'm really Naruto?"
1212222211121121222121122222112212111221.title: He's marked for death

1212222211121121222121122222112212111221.content:
"If you want to tell everyone who you really are, I can't stop you. It is ultimately your call to make if you decide to reveal that you're really Naruto. Just as it's your call who you decide to tell about your prisoner."

Ninata perked up, enough that she could feel the blanket's thin fabric brush against her nipples as her breasts jiggled underneath. "Really? So I don't need to keep up this charade?"

"Let me finish," said Tsunade. "Just because you can doesn't mean you should. Or have you forgotten about the Akatsuki?"

Ninata pouted indignantly. "I sure as hell haven't!" She may not have had the best memory, but she would never forget the sheer power that both Kisame and Itachi displayed. It still gave her shivers at night.

"Then you should know that you're being hunted, Ninata. Sooner or later, they will come for you. Maybe not today, maybe not tomorrow, but someday. And in your current state, you're more vulnerable than ever. But...there is one good thing about your transformation into Hinata..."

Ninata's nostrils flared at that comment. "What do you mean 'one good thing?'" she all but shouted with offense. "Are you saying that being Hinata is bad?"

Tsunade raised an eyebrow in confusion. "Excuse me?"

"I like being Hinata!" the former boy huffed, putting her hands on her hips, which of course caused her blanket to fall, exposing her bare body from the waist up. But she neither noticed nor cared about her nakedness. Nor did she take note of the Hokage's perplexed expression or the drop of sweat beading its way down her face. "Her body is wonderful, perfect in every way, the Byakugan is amazing when it doesn't give me a headache, and it's all because of this that I was able to finally see how gorgeous and beautiful and cute Hinata-chan really is! There's no other body I want to have!"

"I...didn't know you felt that strongly about it," said Tsunade. "I figured you were hoping for a way to change back and would declare that you'd find a way, no matter what, you'd never give up, and...you know the drill."

"I'm not that predictable...am I?" said Ninata. She sure hoped she wasn't. "Anyway, you already said that it's impossible for me to change back. And even my henge won't allow it. So I might as well get used to it. And even if it was possible, I don't want to ever change back! I'm staying with Hinata's body forever and you can't stop me!"

"O...kaaaay," said Tsunade, "if that's what you really want. I'm...glad to see you've adjusted so fast. Not many people would. But as I was saying...an advantage to your transformation into Hinata is that very few people know who you really are. And as long as nobody knows who you really are, they won't have any reason to come after you. If we keep your identity a secret, we can keep you safe from the Akatsuki and anyone else who's looking for you.

"Not to mention I'd rather prevent a panic from breaking out. Your transformation is like nothing anyone's ever seen before. We don't know how it happened to you specifically, we don't know why you became Hinata of all people, we don't know what precisely caused your genes to mutate, and we don't know whether or not it could happen again. I have no explanation for this, I don't even know where to begin looking for one, and if I don't have an answer, then the people will make their own. And that's when we'll have problems. If word got out that you just randomly turned into Hinata one day, I doubt the people of Konoha would take it well. They'd assume that there might be some kind of virus that turns people into the girl and we'd have riots in the streets. I can't let that happen!"

Ninata put a hand to her chin. A whole village full of Hinatas? That was ridiculous! Where would the old woman get such a silly idea? She probably secretly indulged herself in those naughty books the old pervert wrote. It was definitely the kind of thing he'd probably write about. Still, Ninata couldn't get the picture out of her head. A whole village of Hinatas? Sounded like Heaven to her! And what did the old lady know? Maybe the whole village would be totally cool with being Hinatified, and everyone was in fact secretly wishing that they could be the adorable and sexy little Hyuga. And maybe if everyone was turned into Hinata, the world would be a much better place.

But she was getting ahead of herself. This was neither the time nor place to think about a world built in Hinata's image. She had to consider the Hokage's words, and based on her own experiences, she had to admit that as out there as Tsunade's concerns were, they likely held a lot of merit. "I...guess that makes sense."

Tsunade nodded with approval. "Good. It's up to you when you want to reveal your secret, but I would advise keeping a lid on it for as long as possible, at least until you get your abilities up to snuff. Jiraiya will be setting off, and the official story we'll be releasing is that 'Naruto' is training with him. Meanwhile, Hyuga Ninata as we're calling you, a living anomaly of Hinata's yin-yang chakra splitting up and gaining sentience, is now the Leaf's newest Genin."

Ninata nodded. "Okay, Baa-chan. I understand."

"I'm glad you do." Confident that the conversation was now truly done with for real, Tsunade turned around to exit the room and return to her duties. "Oh, and by the way, Ninata, you're still naked. Cover yourself."

"Huh? Eeep!"
1212222211121121222121122222112212111221.title: Keeping the Story Straight

1212222211121121222121122222112212111221.content:
He knew they had come. He could feel the power of his mark pulsing through their coils. It delighted him to sense the movements of his most devoted of servants, to feel the steady beats of their hearts and the air flowing into and out of their lungs as they breathed. It made him feel almost like a god.

But more than anything else, their arrival meant that Orochimaru's prize had finally come. Sasuke accepted his offer, welcomed his power, and would now be enslaved to his will. The Sharingan was nearly his. Nearly. The Sannin couldn't help but quietly seethe at that thought. He wanted desperately to take Sasuke's body as his own, to see the world with the blood-red eyes of the Uchiha, and inherit the power those miniscule orbs of flesh held. But the pain in his arms had been too agonizing, and Kabuto was correct; they couldn't afford to wait any longer for the boy to arrive. He needed a new body, and he needed it immediately.

And sadly, that meant taking what he had available. This latest body was left rather wanting. There was nothing special about its former owner, whose name the sage couldn't recall. He was not the scion of a prestigious lineage and his bloodline held no secrets. He was a nobody, a stop-gap for the Sage of Snakes to use until he was once again physically ready to claim a body of real power.

The door to his inner sanctum opened to reveal Kabuto, Sakon, Ukon, and of course, Sasuke. "They have come to see you," the bespectacled shinobi said.

"Show them in," said Orochimaru from where he sat cross-legged in the center of the chamber. He added a small wave, signaling his assistant to leave them in private. It was a mere formality, of course. Kabuto would hear every word that was uttered from outside.

Kabuto nodded and slid the door shut as Sasuke and Sakon marched inside. The Uchiha was dead-eyed and unemotional, Ukon looked like he was asleep on his brother's back as always, and Sakon looked absolutely livid.

"It is just you three," said Orochimaru. It was not a question.

"You gave us faulty intel!" snarled Sakon. "You told us that our attack weakened Konoha."

Orochimaru snorted with disgust at the impudent whelp. "Boy, if you wish to walk out of this room with all your organs intact, I would suggest you remember your place," he hissed, his voice lowered to a dangerous whisper that still reverberated through the walls of his sanctum. Ukon's face remained resolute in its rage, but the sage did not miss the pale-haired ninja's hesitant half-step backward. That secretly pleased him. Even with this inferior body, he was still able to inspire terror in his subjects. "Your poor leadership abilities have cost me three of my best ninjas. You should be thankful I'm even letting you and your brother speak at all."

As if on cue, Ukon awoke and turned his head to address his master. "That's not what my brother means. You told us the Leaf had only one Jinchūriki."

"I did," said Orochimaru. "The young blonde-haired idiot. You were provided all the information you needed about him. I'm not accountable if you let that fool get the better of you."

Those words struck a reaction from Sasuke. "Blonde-haired... Jinchūriki?" he asked, looking back and forth between the sage and the conjoined twins.

Ukon carried on as though the Uchiha boy had not been there. "No, we didn't see him, there was another. A Hyuga girl in about the same age range. She displayed all the signs."

Orochimaru quirked an eyebrow. He hadn't expected to hear that. "A Hyuga girl you say?"

"Yes!" said Sakon. "She fired up an aura of red chakra, regenerated her wounds, starting looking and acting like a monster..."

In normal circumstances, Orochimaru would have dismissed the claim entirely. But something about the twins' words was intriguing him deeply. "Kabuto!" the Sannin called out, not caring to hear another word out of Sakon. The door slid open to reveal the young spy. "Show our impudent twins everything you have on the younger female members of the Hyuga clan."

"Yes, Orochimaru," said the bespectacled ninja as he entered, pulling out the cards that contained all the hidden information he had gathered on the Leaf's active shinobi. Spreading them on the floor, he formed a sign with his hand, and in an instant, every card displayed an image of a female Hyuga." "Do any of these women look familiar to you?"

"That's her, right there!" said Sakon, pointing to the card depicting one Hyuga Hinata. "But there were two of them present, identical twin sisters. One of them is the Jinchūriki!"

Kabuto rolled his eyes dismissively. "Do you have any idea what you're saying? Hinata is the oldest child to the head of the Hyuga clan. She has only one sister, Hyuga Hanabi, who's around six years her junior. You are mistaken."

"I know what I saw!" said Sakon. "Ask my brother! Ask him!" he pointed at Sasuke. "They were there and they saw it! AAGGHHH!"

Orochimaru clasped a hand on the Cursed Seal marking the twins' shared body and began to pull the chakra from it. It glowed an unearthly black as a cloud of darkness surrounded it. It was a painful procedure, and it sent the conjoined youths down on their knees screaming, but Orochimaru couldn't be bothered to care. He needed to see for himself what Sakon and Ukon had seen, confirm it with his own eyes. And the Cursed Seal allowed him to do just that. It was a part of him, after all.

He saw them, two versions of the Hyuga princess, naked as the day they were born. He saw one, through the eyes of Ukon, standing her ground, fighting with the deftness and grace that the clan was known for, completely unaffected by her nakedness. And he saw the other, barely capable of defending herself. She tried to trick her enemy, but it was for naught, for Sakon soon had her pinned to the ground. He saw Sakon bash her head in, dazing her immediately. And he watched as the arrogant shinobi began to pull down his pants.

Orochimaru snorted in disgust at his underling's actions. He was on a mission of vital importance, and he was wasting time and energy to satisfy his base carnal instincts? The Snake Sage was not known for his sympathy, and he certainly felt none when the crimson chakra erupted from the girl and viciously incinerated the hormone-addled fool right where the sun didn't shine. He deserved no less for displaying such idiocy in the heat of battle. But Sakon's stupidity revealed that he was indeed telling the truth. There could be no mistaking it; this Hinata look-alike did not fight, talk or carry herself like a Hyuga traditionally did. Her mannerisms matched the container of the Kyuubi to a western T, and the red aura she exuded was the very same one the boy had used in the third part of the Chuunin Exam.

The Sannin released his hold on the Cursed Seal, the dark aura of chakra emanating from it flickering out like a dying light bulb. "Identical twin sisters, you say?" he said as a serpentine grin spread across his face. " Jinchūriki...interesting. Very, very interesting."
1212222211121121222121122222112212111221.title: Meanwhile, in the Sound...

1212222211121121222121122222112212111221.content:
"What...was that for?" Sakon snarled as he pushed himself up.

Orochimaru ignored him. "It would seem I did indeed overlook a few details of the Leaf. And it would seem that I've learned something new about our enemies as well. So for that...you and your brother may go. I will see about assembling a new team for you to lead in the future. But until then...rest while you have the chance."

"If you three are done," said Sasuke in an impatient tone, "I have some questions for you myself, Orochimaru. And I would like to discuss my terms. Now."

Orochimaru glared at the Uchiha. For once, he was finding himself completely uninterested in the boy and the latent power he held. "We will do that in good time, boy. Tomorrow. For now, you should get some rest."

But the boy would not be deterred. "I am not tired!" he snorted petulantly.

Orochimaru sighed. Why did he always attract the big-headed egotists who couldn't simply just do what they were told? Flicking his hand dismissively into a few one-handed signs, he watched as the raven-haired youth suddenly went limp and all but fell into the startled Sakon's hands. It was a simple genjutsu that invoked a brief moment of exhaustion in the target. It could be easily disrupted and it wasn't particularly good at long range, making it nigh useless in battle, but when you needed to shut someone up real quick, it was a handy little tool to have.

"See him to his quarters. And keep him locked up if you have to."

"Hold on," said Sakon, "I'm not done with–"

He shut up instantly when Orochimaru looked him hard in the eye with a hateful glare. "Do not try my patience, whelp. I've given you and your brother a second chance. You won't get a third."

"Just...do what he says," grumbled Ukon, who looked like he was still reeling from the pain that Orochimaru's seal-tampering had caused. Sakon didn't look pleased, but he acquiesced to Orochimaru's orders, shuffling out of the sanctum with Sasuke's limp body in tow. Seeing them disappear down the corridor, the Snake Sage saw fit to leave as well, signaling for Kabuto to follow him.

"Is there something I should know?" the bespectacled ninja asked in a neutral tone as he gathered up his cards.

"I'm thinking it is time I tell you about a certain pet project of mine," said the Sannin. "Something I've been working on ever since we came upon that Kimimaro of the Kaguya clan. His body was strong, his bloodline ability was particularly potent, and most of all, he was the only remaining person who could ever use it."

"I remember who he was," said Kabuto. "I was his primary physician when he fell ill after all. And I also know he was a eunuch, a victim of the Water Country's barbaric practices to exterminate any and all Kekkei Genkai."

"Yes, that was very unfortunate," said Orochimaru. "I so would have liked to have bred him and taken his body, but unfortunately, he was a dead end. There was absolutely no way I would have been able to preserve his unique bone abilities the 'traditional' way. So I began looking into alternative methods to keep his legacy alive, ways to create a perfect or partial clone of the boy, or perhaps even just transplant his genes into another person. And I found a way to do just that."

"You devised a new jutsu?" said Kabuto, pushing his glasses up the bridge of his nose inquisitively.

They came upon a flight of stairs and began to descend. "It was no mere jutsu," said Orochimaru, "but a small-scale ritual, you could say, that combines the fields of fūinjutsu with medical science and gene therapy. By taking a mixture of chakra and the right reagents together–don't ask what they are, it would take too long to explain–and injecting them into the body via a seal–any kind of seal, it doesn't matter what–I could create a process that could delve deep into the cells of the subject and alter their genetic structure into anything and anyone that I wished. It would have no visible or immediate effect, but it would be in there, lying in wait, whether they realized it or not. All it would need to activate was contact with a certain humor. A humor that would provide the very blueprint it would need to permanently alter the subject's genetic structure."

A switch seemed to click in Kabuto's head. "You mean..."

Orochimaru grinned. "Blood. As soon as the subject who had been marked touched so much as single drop of blood, the formula would begin its work. It would traverse through the cells of the body like a virus, then rearrange the genes until they were a perfect copy of the blood-touched. I took in many people–beggars, orphans, prisoners–applied the seal to them, and exposed them to foreign blood. Usually Kimimaro's. I hoped that by transforming them into the boy, that I could efficiently create an army of his clones, and possibly even make a future body that I could use for myself with his unique bloodline abilities."

The pair reached the bottom of the stairs and proceeded down another dim corridor, stopping only at a sealed door that was marked as one of Orochimaru's private laboratories. The lock was marked with a seal that would only respond to the Sannin's chakra signature. Only Orochimaru could open this door, and only Orochimaru had ever been inside this specific lab. "I'm going to guess it didn't go quite as planned," said Kabuto.

Orochimaru frowned. "No. It didn't," he said cryptically as he placed his palm on the door. There was an audible click as an inner mechanism shifted, and the door slid open as if it had a will of its own, revealing a laboratory like any other. The walls were lined with shelves and refrigeration units, all filled with to the brim with vials, beakers and jars containing chemicals, bacterial cultures, viruses, fungi, organs, tissue samples, and other substances that would turn the stomachs of those who were weak in constitution. And vision. Steel ducts and wires extended from the ceiling and congregated around an elaborate machine in the back that stood as tall as two men and twice as wide. But that wasn't what interested Orochimaru or his assistant, who was seeing it all for the first time. Their attention was drawn to the table at the center, where stood a great canister holding a shapeless...thing that could be seen floating through the foggy glass.

Closer inspection revealed that it was a human being. A horribly mangled human being. His left arm was noticeably longer, thicker and burlier than his right, and it looked as if it could reach past his knee if he stood at full height. His naked torso looked equally mismatched; one side seemed to boast the impressive muscles of an accomplished athletic, while the other wouldn't have been out of place on a child. Anyone who looked closely at the ribs under his skin could pick up even more deformities. Some jutted prominently out so tightly, it was a wonder they hadn't burst through the flesh. Others looked as though they had snapped, and even more were completely invisible, as though they had sunk even deeper into his innards.

Most people would have retched at the sight. But Orochimaru and Kabuto were content to stare coolly at the deformed corpse.

"As you can see," said Orochimaru, "it turns out that the process of changing from one form to another physically without the use of a proper Henge is not so easy. People are built differently. Different sizes, different shapes. And unfortunately, my formula wasn't perfect when it came to genetic infusion. The change was always...uneven. Some parts would change and others would not. Sometimes, a bone would shift in size and stab through a major artery or two. In others, one organ would grow in size and crush all the others. And in this fellow's case, I believe his lungs expanded faster than his ribcage. The end result was always the same: the subject would die partway through the transformation."

"And it looked like the process was extremely painful as well," said Kabuto, noting the subject's face, which was permanently frozen into a scream of anguish.

"That too," said the snake ninja. "Had to use up a lot of good chakra just to silence their wails. None of them were able to bear pain the way Kimimaro could." He frowned. Thinking about the last scion of the Kaguya clan was always a bitter pill for the self-proclaimed Otokage. Even if he had been an evolutionary dead end, he was still a talented ninja, far more skilled and intelligent than his four idiot underlings. And loyal too. It was a shame Kimimaro came down with that terminal illness, but at least he was willing to let Orochimaru harvest his body for future use before it fully claimed him. Not one part of the young man would go to waste. Blood, marrow, bone, muscle tissue, the internal organs, all had value. Heck, Orochimaru could even make a stylish wig out of his hair!

"And what of the transformation process?" asked Kabuto, who was clearly more interested in hearing about Orochimaru's project.

"The issue was that the genes would start to change before all the body's cells were properly infected. If there was to be any hope for the subject to survive the change, then that step in the process needed to be delayed for as long as possible. I found that in order to yield better results, I had to change up the formula, alter the ratio of components. Most annoyingly, I needed to throw in a greater concentration of the most expensive and difficult-to-acquire reagents. That would stall the transformation, allow the concoction to infect more cells before it began to alter the genes. But it was never enough; no matter how potent the mixture was, and no matter how long I stalled the change, it was still too fast and uneven for a body to handle. Around the time of the Chuunin Exam, I just about had it and threw ever last bit of the rare reagents I had into my latest formula.
1212222211121121222121122222112212111221.title: The Secret Project

1212222211121121222121122222112212111221.content:
"It was, I admit, a rash action borne entirely of frustration, and when I realized what I had done, I decided to halt my experiments for the time being. I wanted to see if it would work, but the concoction I had was simply too valuable to simply use on any mere test subject. It would need to be something special, something unique, to convince me it was worth expending. I put it out of mind and focused all my energies on the invasion of the Leaf. Progress could wait, war could not. But I kept it with me, even as I infiltrated their Genin forces and went to go see what the Uchiha boy was capable of in the Forest of Death.

"And then, inspiration struck me. I encountered the Nine-Tailed brat, I saw firsthand how the beast within could influence him, and more than that, I had him in my grasp! Subduing him would have been easy enough, but I wondered; what effect would my formula have over a Jinchūriki? I didn't know if I'd have another chance, so with a simple Five Elements Seal, I injected it into him. I figured that after we conquered the Leaf, I would be able to capture and observe him afterward...assuming it didn't kill him by then."

Unfortunately, that was another scheme that didn't go according to plan. And despite his relatively good mood, the Sannin couldn't help but scowl again. Thinking about his failures was always a surefire way to ignite his wrath.

"So what you're saying," said Kabuto, "is you applied the seal and the formula to Uzumaki Naruto, and you believe that it's caused him to take on Hinata's form?"

"There is no doubt," said Orochimaru. "I saw what Sakon and Ukon saw. The Nine-Tails brat is the very first to survive and successfully undergo my process!"

Kabuto still looked doubtful. "But he lasted the entire month leading up to the third part of the exam without undergoing any changes. And we saw him weeks later when we tried to make contact with Tsunade, and he still looked the same. And I thought you wanted him dead?"

Orochimaru nodded. "Indeed. At the time, I thought that perhaps the fox within made him immune to its effects, and had written the whole thing off as a failure. He was useless to me as an experiment, and he was, and still is, a very problematic element in my plans. Or will be in the long run. But it would seem that either he hadn't made contact with anyone's blood in that time, which I find highly unlikely...or that the effect was stalled for an abnormally long amount of time. Long enough for every cell in his body to be affected before the transformation began. And it was either due to the unique mixture that was injected into him, the influence of the demon, or both.

"Whatever the case may be, he has successfully undergone the transformation. Every part of the brat likely changed evenly and at the exact same time. No bone or organ grew out of place, no tissue or blood vessel stretched beyond its bounds. Judging by the change to his genitals, it would seem he even switched sexes flawlessly."

"I'm...not going to ask how you figured out that last part," said Kabuto as he kneaded his forehead. Orochimaru could only shrug at that. He didn't know what she and her now twin were doing running around naked in the woods either, but that's what he saw and he would take what he gleaned from it for all that it was worth. The Nine-Tails brat now sported a very womanly labia and a mature pair of mammary glands.

"But do you have any idea when Uzumaki came into contact with the Hyuga girl's blood?" said Kabuto.

"It doesn't matter," said Orochimaru. "All that I care about is that my project was a success and that I can now proceed with it. Some things are just not worth knowing."

"So now that you've told me all this," said Kabuto, "what is the next step? Do you intend for us to take the Jinchūriki now?"
1212222211121121222121122222112212111221.title: The Secret Project Part II

1212222211121121222121122222112212111221.content:
Orochimaru shook his head. "Tempting. But no. Nothing would delight me more than to hack the brat open and see what makes her new body tick, but going in so soon is risky. She's under the protection of Jiraiya and Tsunade, and after losing Sasuke, the Leaf will likely be on high alert for quite some time. It would be best if we...waited for a time."

Kabuto nodded. "Very well. Still, I'll see if there's not some way we can monitor her."

The two exited the lab and began their trek back to the upper parts of the Sound Village. All the while, the smirk never left Orochimaru's face. This day had taken a surprisingly insightful turn. He had the Uchiha right where he wanted him. He had an experiment that was starting to yield fruit. And with it, he had possibly yet another way to strengthen his military force. And maybe, just maybe...he would have a strong, young Uchiha body and a pair of Sharingan eyes much sooner than he expected.

This time...all will go according to plan.

=====

Naruto glared hatefully at Neji. That look of absolutely murderous fury had melted away into the most obnoxiously smug shit-eating grin the blonde had ever seen. He may not have killed the girl as he so wished, but he still hurt her plenty, and he damn well knew that he wouldn't be suffering any repercussions for it.

Naruto didn't know what the story was between these two Hyugas. He didn't know what Hinata had done to deserve Neji's wrath. Hell, he couldn't imagine how anything could justify the severe beating and emotional thrashing the older genin subjected the quiet girl to. But Neji's arrogant attitude and his inability to shut his damn mouth about fate and destiny pissed the blonde off to no end.

Naruto didn't know Hinata all that well, but her desire to improve herself and rise above everyone's low expectations of her was something he understood very intimately. And he wasn't going to stand still and let her get pushed around by some fatalistic jackass who was too cowardly to face his problems head-on. Hinata couldn't get up and prove him wrong, but Naruto most certainly could. And come the next part of the exam, he would. He didn't care if the arrogant Hyuga asshole was a genius, or if he was the top of his class; Naruto was going to ensure that Neji's only destiny would be to have a smile that was all gums. This he silently swore for Hinata's sake.

Taking a handful of the girl's blood that now stained the arena grounds, which was still warm to the touch, he raised a fist in the older ninja's direction. "You're going down."

=====

"Whoa, that was odd," said Ninata to herself. She had just been ambling down the street when all of a sudden, her mind went back to that specific moment in the Chuunin exam. It was so weird to think back on, knowing especially how far they had both come since then.

Still, she was happy. She had a shiny new ninja ID and would soon be going back to work. Granted, she wished she at least had a chance to properly comb her hair for it; she still had a slight "bed head" going on when the photo was taken. And she kind of wished that maybe she could have done her face up to look prettier. And thinking even more, she couldn't help but grumble, knowing that she was going to be stuck doing lowly D-rank missions for a while. But it was a small price to pay. She got to train, work and live with the cutest, sweetest, nicest and sexiest girl in the world!

Speaking of which...

She was at the door of her new apartment when it suddenly slid open to reveal Hinata. Her large lavender eyes widened when she saw her twin staring back at her. "Ninata-chan, you're home already?"

"Sure am!" said Ninata with a grin. "Why, did I interrupt something? Are you going somewhere."

"I...was," said Hinata. She was poking her index fingers into one another as she often did, though Ninata did not miss the impish smile that was spreading across her face. "But...I think it can wait."

Before Ninata could say another word, her double all but yanked her inside. Soft pink lips smothered her own, warm air cascaded onto her legs as the trousers Tsunade lent fell into a pile at her feet, and Hinata's greedy hands started pulling at the hem of her shirt.

The door slammed shut. Ninata was home.

=====

A few days went by without incident. The girls spent much of the time between their lovemaking sessions doing what they could to make their new home more livable. They arranged the furniture, decorated the walls with whatever sparse paintings and photos they had, and cleaned up a few stray cobwebs. They also set about the task of disposing of all the things that could be traced back to Naruto, including all the tacky orange jackets and pants that had originally dominated his wardrobe. That had been a bittersweet affair for the girl that he had turned into, but she understood why it was necessary.

That wasn't all Hinata believed she needed to do; there was still the issue of Tenten. She couldn't explain it, but she felt some level of responsibility for the older girl, particularly since she had saved her life. And while the black-haired kunoichi was in safe hands now, the blunette thought it was only right to maybe go see her in the hospital. Perhaps even with some flowers in hand. That seemed like a good idea, and she knew just the right place to go.

When Hinata stepped into the Yamanaka-owned flower shop, she was a bit surprised to see Ino manning the register. The blonde looked tired, and she was wearing more makeup than usual to hide the bags around her eyes.

"Hi, welcome to Yamanaka Flowers!" she announced in voice full of artificial pep while wearing an equally artificial smile. It was clear she was trying to look happier than she really was.

"Hello, Ino-san," said Hinata as she picked up a violet hydrangea, which seemed like the perfect 'get well soon' flower.

"Is this for Ninata?" asked the blonde.

"No, this is for Tenten-san. Though I should get something for Ninata-chan." She eyed a pack of orange lily seeds. She never imagined that Ninata was much for flowers, but if she did, she'd probably like those. They'd make a suitable replacement for her clothes. In more ways than one. "I'll take some of these too. Our home could use some more color, and Ninata said she'd like to start growing some plants."

"Aw, that's really nice. Wish I had someone like you," said Ino. Before Hinata could ask what exactly she meant by that, the blonde's fake smile evaporated. "I've been seeing Chouji whenever I can myself. Leaving him flowers too, hoping that he'll wake up soon. But there's been nothing. And I just can't talk to that lazy idiot, Shikamaru. He's avoiding me, won't talk to anyone. Don't think he's gone to see his friend either, the jackass. Sometimes, he just makes me so...but I really shouldn't unload my problems onto you. I know you lost someone too."

Hinata nodded. "It's okay. And I'm sorry about Chouji-san as well."

Ino nodded sadly in silent thanks as she rung up the Hyuga's items. With that business taken care of, Hinata took her things in hand and began to leave. However, she couldn't help but let her heart go out to Ino. Hinata knew the feeling of loss, but she could weather it. She had her Ninata. But poor Ino was all alone. The Hyuga couldn't fathom why the blonde was working on what was likely her day off, but if she could hazard a guess, it was to try and keep her mind off of things. She couldn't help but shake her head at that thought. Problems needed to be dealt with, not avoided.

"Ino-san," she said, turning around, "if you ever need someone to talk to...you can always come to me."

=====

"Hello, Tenten-san."

"Oh?" the bun-haired girl looked up from her hospital bed, startled from the intrusion. "Hinata? What are you doing here?"

Hinata shrugged. "I just thought I should come and see how you were doing. I brought you something." She withdrew the flower she had just purchased from Ino and gave it to the older girl.

Tenten was clearly stumped as her fingers wrapped around the hydrangea's stem. "Um...are you asking me out?"

"What? Oh, no!" Hinata half-gasped and half-chuckled, feeling a warm blush on her cheeks. "No, I'm just wishing for you to get well soon. That's all!"

"Oh, I see," said Tenten. Hinata thought she detected a hint of disappointment in the brunette's voice, but simply brushed it aside. "Heh, sorry, I always just kind of assume that flowers were used as some kind of courting ritual. But thanks, I appreciate it. And I didn't get to tell you the last time I saw you, but thanks for saving me. I don't know how I could ever repay you." She took a deep sniff into the hydrangea's petals. "To be honest, though, I'm feeling kind of nervous."

"Nervous? About what?"

"I'm going under the knife soon. They're going to fix up my leg. Hokage-sama and the doctors all assured me that I'd be fine, but there's always a chance that things could go wrong. And, well, there's not really much I can do but wait."

Hinata frowned. She could understand that. Surgery was always scary. "I'm sorry, Tenten-san."

Tenten shook her head. "Don't be. I'm just over-thinking it. Lee had it much worse than I did, and he got through his surgery just fine. He's walking again, and he sees me every now and then. If he got through his problems, then my chances have to be pretty good as well...right?"

"Don't worry Tenten-san," said Hinata as she placed a hand reassuringly on the brunette's shoulder. "I'm sure everything will be all right."

Tenten locked eyes with her and gave Hinata a very meaningful look that she couldn't help but swear was beyond platonic. "Thanks, Hinata, that means a lot. Maybe once I'm out of here, we can...I dunno, train together? Hang out? Do something...fun, you, me and Ninata?"

Hinata smiled at her. "I'd like that." And maybe we could bring Ino-san as well.
1212222211121121222121122222112212111221.title: No

They're just going to train today.

"Which is good," Kurenai continued, "because what I have in mind for you two will work better if it's just us."

"You'll see soon enough. First, we'll need to go someplace more secluded. Come."

The older woman turned around and set off towards the forest. Ninata gave Hinata a questioning glance as if to ask her "Does she do this all the time?" Hinata responded with a face that might as well have been her reflection. She didn't know what was going on either.

Wordlessly, the two followed their sensei out of the training field, into the forest surrounding Konoha, and away from the village limits. Ninata chewed at her lip nervously. The last time she had gone into the woods, she and Hinata got mixed up in that business with the Sound, the twins and Sasuke, and the bitter memories were still fresh in her mind. But the silence Kurenai was treating them to wasn't helping either. The boy-turned-girl didn't know a thing about the older woman. Was she a strict teacher? Was she mad that they were late? Was she taking them out into the woods so that she could indulge herself in her one and only passion in life: hunting the most dangerous game?

"No, don't stuff me and mount my head on the wall!" she cried out in a panic. "Taxidermy would ruin my cuteness! I'd make a terrible trophy!"

Two pairs of very confused eyes turned towards her. "Excuse me?" Kurenai said with a quirked eyebrow.

Ninata's cheeks grew very warm. "Er...did I just say that out loud?" she asked, wringing her hands nervously.

"Yes, you did."

"Ninata-chan, are you feeling okay?" said Hinata as she pressed a hand to her girlfriend's forehead. "You feel a little feverish."

"I'm fine!" said Ninata. "I'm just...just..." She trailed off. What did cause that outburst anyway?

"Okay, I guess this is far enough then," said Kurenai, though the amused smirk on her face couldn't be missed. "The sooner we get this training exercise done, the sooner we can get Ninata back to civilization before she completely loses her mind."

Hinata brought a hand to her lips as she giggled at the older woman's quip. Ninata could only sulk. This was just great. She only knew her new sensei for about 30 minutes now, and already she made a complete fool of herself. And worse, Kurenai was apparently a smartass. Why couldn't she be like most of the women in Ninata's life? Why couldn't Kurenai just deck her whenever she said something stupid?

"Sit down, both of you," said Kurenai, her voice getting all businesslike again. "I have something to show you." She turned around as the twins complied, forming the seal of the ram with her hands.

She watched as a patch of the bandage-like cloth on Kurenai's tunic glowed a faint orange before it transformed into a butterfly made entirely of light and fluttered away. And then it was followed by another. And another. Soon, dozens of flame-hued butterflies were fanning out from Kurenai's form, and with each one that appeared, so did a speck of the older woman's pale skin.

Hinata and Ninata stared transfixed as more and more of their teacher's clothing disintegrated. Her arms were completely bare, the wild tresses of her black hair spilled freely over her naked shoulders, the visible muscles on her back could be traced with an observant eye, and if they looked carefully enough, they could even make out the very tip of the woman's butt cleavage as it peered out from the remains of her breeches...and soon enough, even those was gone. It was painful to have to open up old wounds again, but the born Hyuga was able to soldier on without shedding any more tears. Things were rough for Ninata too. About a week later, she had her first period. Though Ninata knew about and understood the general science behind the menstrual cycle, she was woefully unprepared when it hit her in full force. She needed time to heal of course, and she had to walk around with crutches for a few weeks, which was disheartening. But spending time in the company of her fellow kunoichi made it bearable. Always the tomboy with a fascination for all things sharp and pointy, Tenten never thought she had much in common with other girls, but she soon found that wasn't the case at all with Ino, Sakura, Ninata, and her savior, Hinata. Remembering their past talk in the woods, Hinata in particular encouraged Tenten to try looking into the interests she hadn't yet taken time to pursue while she recovered. "Okay then, so you're right here," said Tenten as she looked over her chart of the sexagenarian cycle. "And you were born on...the 27th, correct?"

"Alright," said Tenten. "So all I have to do then is get a feel for the shape of your body, and then we can begin."

Hinata tilted her head quizzically. "The shape of my body?"

"Yes, I need to see into your inner yin and yang if I want to tell your fortune," said Tenten. "Should be interesting, seeing how yours split up and all."

"Of course," said Hinata, spreading her arms to give her friend free rein over her body. Tenten thought she saw the Hyuga's lips curl up into a slight grin, but she ignored it. She wasn't here to...pleasure the Hyuga, she was just here to read her fortune for fun. That's all she was here for: good traditional fun. Putting a hand on each of the blunette's shoulders, she gently squeezed them to get a feel for the smaller girl's muscles before trailing down the lengths of her arms.

She's so slender, the brunette thought. I wonder how smooth her skin would feel if...no, stop thinking that way, Tenten! This is no time to–

Chouji was unfortunately not waking up, and it broke her heart to watch him grow thinner with each passing day. Shikamaru was no help; he may have been putting more time and effort into his training and leadership studies than ever before, but the already reclusive boy was becoming increasingly more distant. She knew he was crushed by guilt for failing his mission. He blamed himself for Sasuke's defection, Chouji's coma, and Kiba's death. But he wouldn't let anyone come near him anymore, and the blonde for the life of her couldn't penetrate his walls. She would have fallen into depression, but rekindling her friendship with Sakura and being in the company of the other girls did much to keep her spirits up. Most surprisingly, she and Ninata found a lot of commonality in their mutual love of watching plants grow.

"Your lilies are coming out really nice," she said while examining some of the potted flowers Ninata had growing around the apartment.

"Thanks," said the blunette as she sprinkled water over a particularly large pot. "You've been a really big help. If I tended to them myself, I'd probably drown the poor things."

"No problem," Ino replied, tilting her head to get a better look at Hinata's twin. Around them, she didn't have to worry about her training, or if guys thought she was pretty, or whether or not she'd come back from her next assignment alive, or about Chouji's condition. Maybe it was their seemingly innocent demeanor rubbing off on her (though Ino was quite aware their relationship was most definitely not innocent), but something about the twins made it seem like it was okay to be carefree.

If only she had a Hinata of her own.

As for Tsunade, she continued to closely monitor the twins. Every week, she'd give them a thorough medical examination just to make sure there weren't any complications. There weren't; Ninata's genes displayed no further changes, and Hinata was completely unaffected. And though it was prying into private territory, she also questioned them about their sex life. Both girls admitted to having sex every day for months on end, save for whenever they menstruated. It honestly baffled the aged woman; the twins' sexual proclivity dwarfed even the most hormonal of teenagers by multiple country miles. And despite her best efforts, there was nothing Tsunade could do to quell the girls' physical need for each other. No matter what drugs she fed them, jutsus she cast on them, rituals she invoked, teas she served, and meditative therapy she put them through, Hinata and Ninata would always crave one another sooner or later. Something about Ninata's bizarre transformation into Hinata awakened an insatiable lust in both girls, a kind of hypersexuality she had never seen before, but Tsunade would be damned if she could figure out why.

But besides that, they were both perfectly healthy, growing young girls. And the Hokage supposed that was really all that mattered. As long as Ninata was happy, then Tsunade was happy.

There was, however, one anomaly that concerned the Hokage, something she had only recently discovered. Looking over their health charts over the past few months, she noticed that there had been a steady rise in both girls' chakra levels. Now, they didn't have the exact amount of chakra per se. Thanks to the influence of the demon fox and the genetic remnants of her old self, Ninata had more to spare, though her abysmal control meant she tended to run dry a lot faster. But the rate that each twin's chakra improved was not only greater than it was for most people, but both sets of chakra were perfectly parallel with one another, as if even their growth was in synch.

"Is this due to their near exact physiologies?" Tsunade asked herself, speaking into a recorder. "They are growing girls, it's pretty normal for chakra levels to start rising at their age. But I've never seen such a steady, exact and I daresay even rapid a rise like this. What could possibly be causing it? Is it another symptom to Ninata's transformation? And will it ever stop?"

It wasn't a bad thing; a ninja could never have too much chakra after all. And if the rates continued as they were, then both girls could very well reach Kage levels of chakra before they were 20! But it still concerned the Hokage. Everything about Ninata only raised questions and no answers. And it could only leave her wondering what else awaited the former Uzumaki.

1212222211121121222121122222112212111221.title: New Year's Day

choices: Her performance is what you would expect.
1212222211121121222121122222112212111221.content:
The celebrations were in full swing across Konoha. It had been an eventful year for the village, for the five girls, and especially for the one who used to be a boy. There had been a lot of hardship and a lot of loss. But they endured, and with endurance came rejuvenation and a chance to grow stronger than ever.

The girls wandered around for a while to simply take in the sights and sample some of the local goods. The air was filled with the beating of taiko drums and the sweet scents of tea, incense and sesame. Brilliant red and orange banners and ribbons fluttered in the breeze. There was raucous singing and heavy footsteps in the distance, which revealed upon investigation, that a parade was making its way through the streets, trailed by dancers and headed by a massive scarlet dragon puppet.

No one seemed too eager to do anything just yet. They were content to simply revel in the splendor around them, and enjoy some nice sugary treats. They only stopped at the sound of an explosion. Running to investigate, the girls came upon a square stage in an open marketplace, surrounded by people on all sides who were viewing and laughing at the proceedings.

On one corner of the stage sat a small troupe of musicians all playing various instruments, while in the center stood an assortment of people. Most were dressed head to toe in tight black garbs, and one was a particularly burly man who wore a fancy elaborate navy blue robe embroidered with the images of dark purple-grey storm clouds and lightning bolts. He was laughing heartily onstage with a sake jug in hand as he stumbled around in some kind of drunken dance. This went on until he tripped on a large stage prop that looked like some kind of large plush animal, causing him to fall and roll comically on the floor, which shook and thundered with his movements. The entire audience burst into laughter.

This definitely caught the girls' attention, and they all stood in rapt attention to see what would happen next. As the big man got back on his feet, wearing an expression of indignity on his face, the black-garbed people rushed to the animal and raised it to a standing position, revealing that it was some kind of horse puppet. A noise went off from the musician's corner that could only be summed up as an annoyed nicker.

"You dare challenge the great Susano-o?" the man roared in a deep booming voice. The horse "shook" its head in annoyance at him, letting out another nicker. "So be it, then!" he responded. The man, Susano-o, then seized the puppet and with a firm yank, took off its furry hide, rendering the horse hairless and revealing its peach "flesh" to the world.

"What is this?" said Ninata, tilting her head to the side.

"I think this may be the story of Amaterasu and Ame-no-Uzume," said Sakura.

Ninata recognized the name of Amaterasu, the goddess of the sun, but drew a blank at Uzume. And she had to wonder that if the play was about them, what was Susano-o, the god of storms, doing here? She just never knew much about mythology and religion outside of the very basics.

An embarrassed nicker went off as the black-garbed stagehands rose the horse up onto its hind legs and crossed its "arms" over its chest and "groin" as if it was trying desperately to cover its nudity. Everyone laughed at its cartoonish antics, including the five friends. "Though I have to say," said Sakura, "I don't think I've ever seen it told quite like this before."

"Still want to fight, eh?" said Susano-o. "Then take this! Hai-yooooooo-YA!" He threw a series of exaggerated punches and kicks into the horse, whose operators made to react in equally exaggerated ways. It doubled over as a fist connected with its stomach, flung its head back when another hit its muzzle, and twirled around in a circle when it made an acquaintanceship with Susano-o's soles. Finally, the actor grabbed the beast with both hands and through coordinated effort with the stagehands, lifted the animal above his head and hurled it. The operators ran in circles around the stage, twirling the horse around as though it was helplessly spinning through the air, hilariously neighing all the while.

It was at this point when a new character entered the stage: a woman wearing a radiant kimono dyed in the warm colors of the sun, with sleeves so long they nearly reached the floor. How she was able to glide along so fluidly with nary a stumble was anyone's guess. Every inch of skin that could be seen, from her hands, to her face, to her collar, and to the enticing nape of her neck, was powdered white as snow, which made her long midnight-hued hair and cherry-colored lips stand out all the more.

Ninata would have mused at how beautiful she was and start fantasizing how Hinata would look if she tried a similar getup, if the horse had not collided with the actress and sent her crashing to the ground, to the laughter of everyone present. Looking in horror at the hairless remains of her mare, the actress, who was clearly playing Amaterasu, stood up with an expression of pure rage, which she directed with laser-guided precision at Susano-o.

What followed was a lengthy fight between the two gods. There was much screaming, shouting, and throwing of flowery insults at one another, alongside the occasional blunt object.

"...motherless stinking son of a Krasue!" screamed Amaterasu.

"...rainbow-pissing, excrement-hurling, fish-breathed she-wolf!" retorted Susano-o.

"My breath does not smell of fish!"

It was all in good fun. The gods were very creative with their names, and the accompanying music, though played via traditional instruments, was very comical. That all ended when things turned violent and Susano-o threw a punch at Amaterasu's face, sending her to the floor. The music stopped dead and a collective gasp fell over the audience.

"That bastard, I'll show him," hissed Ninata.

Hinata had to grab her by the sleeve before she did anything stupid. "Ninata-chan, please, it's just a play...I think."

Amaterasu pushed herself off the floor with shaky arms. Looking up at Susano-o, who appeared absolutely horrified at what he had just done, her previously furious expression twisted into one of sadness and hurt. Sobbing, she fled from the stage, leaving what was supposed to be her home in the heavens behind.

The scenery on the stage shifted at that point. From the musical troupe, a narrator took over, detailing how in her grief and anger, the sun goddess fled into a cave. Without her light to shine upon the world, life began to dwindle. Plants withered, people starved, and the spirits weakened in the darkness. Actors and stagehands moved on and off the stage to demonstrate these calamities.

Ninata had to stifle a yawn. Man, how long is this going to go on? she silently groaned. She rather enjoyed the first part of the play, which was really funny, but she was finding this section kind of slow. And what wasn't boring her was absolutely depressing. This was supposed to be a day of celebration, so why were they watching something that was doing its damnedest to sour everything? She really just wanted to go. However, looking at her girlfriends, she saw she was clearly out-voted in that department. Only Tenten appeared to share her disinterest, but Hinata, Sakura and Ino were really getting into things, if their wide eyes were anything to go by.

"And it was then that Ame-no-Uzume devised a way to draw the sun goddess out from her self-imposed exile," said the narrator.

A new actress came upon the stage. She was shorter than the previous one, more petite and slender. She wore a simple white kimono with scarlet trimming, and had her black hair cut in a cute pageboy style. Ribbons of the same shades of white and red were tied into it, and they trailed just past her shoulders. She carried with her a washtub, which she placed upside-down at the entrance of the cave where Amaterasu had hidden herself. Stooping over it, she began to pat it as if it were a drum, and it indeed let out a booming sound not unlike the taiko that could be heard all across town. Or maybe that was thanks to the person who was playing the drum to the side. She started out with a slow beat, but steadily worked her way up to a fast rhythm, which she seemed to playfully sway her behind to, until she finally climbed up onto the washtub.

Standing on the impromptu instrument, the actress playing Ame-no-Uzume began to dance. She swayed her hips one way and her body the other in fluid serpentine motions and spun slowly about on her feet to give everyone surrounding the stage a full view of her movements from every angle. She cast many longing glances at the cave, made graceful beckoning gestures with her hands, and though she didn't say anything, Ninata could see she was mouthing "Come, my goddess," just from the movement of her lips.
1212222211121121222121122222112212111221.title: They attend a show or ceremony

1212222211121121222121122222112212111221.content:
Neither ceasing her movements nor taking her eyes off the cave, Uzume's hand crept to her red obi, which was tied in a bow on her front. With a deft tug, she undid the entire thing, and let the fabric fall carelessly to the floor.

She couldn't be.

She was. Uzume pulled the front panels of her kimono away from her chest, offering more teasing glimpses of the creamy skin on her collar. As she began to spin away from the view of Ninata and her friends, she loosened the fabric so far back they could see her bare shoulder. There was uproar from the audience on the other side of the stage as the actress faced them, both her arms and the panels of her kimono spread out as far as they could possibly go. Some people cheered, some laughed, some wolf-whistled, and more than a few parents covered their children's eyes before scurrying away.

"What's going on?" said Ninata, as she comically hopped to get a better look at what was going on, even though nothing was really obstructing her view.

"You'll see, Ninata-chan," giggled Hinata.

Uzume cast off her clothing and revealed what she wore underneath. Which wasn't much. She wasn't naked, but she might as well have been, for her costume looked like it did everything it could to spit in the face of what was considered proper and taboo in polite society. A series of vines snaked around her skin. They coiled up her legs, her slender thighs and all along her torso. One particularly thick tendril extended its way down into the cleft of her butt, effectively covering it up without hiding it at all.
